reviewDescription: With over 10,000 users of this razor, and high positive averages, I thought it would be a good choice.  My first try on a 2 day old beard, was not what I had expected. It pulled and took a few passes to achieve a fairly close shave, but I could still feel a stubble. I then picked up my old trusty Henry’s razor and finished the shave to a close and smooth finish.  I passed the razor on to my wife for shaving her legs and underarms. So far, she tried it once on her underarms and experienced a similar pulling sensation. I’m waiting to hear about her legs.  If the results are similar for her legs, into the trash it will go and I’ll be out the cost and will stay with Harry’s.

I have been using the Schick Hydro5 for several years because it gives the extremely close shave that I seek. I decided to give the Amazon brand 5 blade razor a try. I have used 4 of the cartridges and have come to the conclusion that it does not provide the closeness I want;  I find changing the Amazon cartridges is quite difficult and awkward. I usually get 3 very close shaves from the Hydro5 but I am lucky to get 2 from the Amazon brand. I have a fairly coarse beard and always stroke across the grain so perhaps the Amazon blade is better suited to less coarse beards.

reviewTitle: If you want cheap go for it.
reviewDescription: I've been used to using five blade Gillette fusion, also three blade Gillette Atra.Both gave a quality shave without pulling or having to go over it twice.You buy these blades and razor thinking they're going to compare whatsoever your dead wrong. I bought them 16 blades and a handle for some $25 whatever it was.I've shaved twice with it now I'm fixing to throw them in the trash.Throw away razors do better than these things doGoing back to Gillette atra cuz these blades really really are not worth $5 they pull they shave very rough I would not recommend them to my worst enemy.

I got this handle with blades just to try this system. I was hoping to find something equivalent to Harry's brand blades at a more Amazon-economical price - but this wasn't it. They are around 20% cheaper, and the feel and the resulting shave seem like they're sort of in the same ballpark - but just not as good as Harry's. Longevity seem slightly less too.This is not scientific - just my subjective judgement. *If* I had more more $$$ to spend I might try Henson Shaving AS13 next.

I've used Gillette since I began shaving and wanted something less expensive. The Amazon basic is about half the price but not nearly as good as Gillette. I had alot of areas on my cheeks, around my lips and under chin that was not as close. Maybe my face needs to get adjusted to the new style (just like switching from razor to electric). I'm going to continue using to finish up the Amazon Basic brand for now but will most likely switch back to Gillette.

reviewTitle: Cheap & You Get What You Pay For
reviewDescription: I ordered these by accident but the best thing I can say about them is they are cheap and you basically get what you pay for. Gillette Fusion 5 gives a much superior closer shave and can handle angles the Amazon cheapie just can't manage.If you're on a budget, these will get the job done and do a fine job but as for me, I'll be going back to Fusion 5 as my go to

reviewTitle: Value but cut my head up each use
reviewDescription: I'm bald, I've shaved my head since I was 20, I'm currently 30 so I've shaven my head for 10 years. I wanted to try a cheaper option as my preferred brand went up in price (again). I strongly dislike the buzz cut look you get at about 3 days, so I shave daily and maybe once a week after 48 hours.The issue with this is the fact my head doesn't have time to fully heal over in 24-48 hours when I need the shave again. This causes a cut of any size to keep reopening every time you shave, you can't avoid it unless you don't shave for about 5 days. These minor cuts can easily drag on for a week or two, which on a bald head really sticks out.I don't like it, needless to say I've used this razor three times now, each time it has cut me, most razors will cut you, heads really are not taken into account when it comes to manufacturing, some times the blades spacing is just enough to nick any curve on your head (which there is many).Some brands work better than others, but given the daily shaving (and the size of a head) you tend to burn through blades quickly. It adds up fast so I like to try new brands in hopes I can save some cash, it pays off every now and then sadly this was a miss for me. 3 shaves 3 good cuts I could instantly feel, for context I get cut by my preferred brand maybe once every 3 months.The shave was never smooth, felt harsh with slight tugging on hair, the heads where also pretty large which makes it hard to work with since only about 50% of the head is the blades, I couldn't get a good feel over what parts the blade shaved and it was simply the other 50% passing over.The handle while looking cheap felt nice, I kinda liked it, liked where they put the grips at, felt good in the hand and was easy enough to control shaving the back side of my head with in the shower, I simply wasn't a fan of the blades or cartridge size, it reminding me more than anything of those cheap disposable 1 use razors I bought as a teen.I can't say how they work on the face since I have a beard, but as for heads this isn't a recommendation from me.

reviewTitle: These blades hurt more than others.  At least they hurt me
reviewDescription: I see good reviews and I'm surprised because... OUCH!  Somehow these aren't for me.Could it be that I assumed incorrectly that I have sensitive skin, and that's the problem?  All I know is my favorite shaving gel is for sensitive skin and I don't exactly have the facial hair of a lumberjack.  So I figured my skin is sensitive.  So, what makes these "for sensitive skin"?  The angle?  The sharpness?  The steel?  I really don't know... I just know that these hurt and my last blades didn't.  They tug as if they're dull.  The old ones were Gillette I believe, nearly identical appearance to these.  The old ones didn't cause any problem for up to a month or so each blade head, and I would change them only because it had been a while and seemed sanitary, even though they worked great and cause no pain.

reviewTitle: You mileage may vary:  updated June 2020
reviewDescription: I have been using the Gillette Fusion system for years (currently the ProGlide), probably 10+ years.  In that time I dabbled using razors from other mail order companies like Harry's and Dollar Shave Club, always returning to Gillette.  I am generally a fan of generics because they are usually ~80% as good for about 50% (or less of the price) so I decided to give this a try.  [UPDATED...again]+ Price as of the original draft was Gillette Fusion blades are $2.81 / Count on Amazon and the Solimos are about $1.20 / count (Yes, it does depend on how many you buy, but the basic math works).  WINNER SOLIMO:  MUCH Cheaper+ Shave closeness-I was shocked to find the Solimo shaves closer.  I'm a 40-something white dude so I have been shaving for ~30 years  WINNER:  SOLIMO+ [UPDATE] While the blades are so cheap you can change them often.  I found you do have to change them at least once/week.  The shape of the Solimo Baldes means you have to be super careful shaving your chin and under your nose.  I have nicked myself a few times and actually had to change my technique WINNER:  Gillette-  [UPDATE] Handle:  the Gillette handles are better, they have a better attachment mechanism and the area you grip has a better shape WINNER:  Gillette.  I really hate the SOLIMO attachment mechanism.  As often as you change the blades it should be seamless, it isn't- [UPDATE] Trimmer blade on the back of the razor blade.  Gillette is FAR superior.  I am not sure what is up with the Solimo Trimmer blade but I felt like I was using an old pocket knife.  I could feel the hair of my sideburns being pulled versus cleanly sliced.  It did get the job done, but OUCH.  The trimmer on the back of the blades seems worse every blade I try.  They do not cut hair cleanly but they sure do nick your face.  WINNER:  GilletteUPDATED BOTTOM LINE:  WINNER GILLETTE:  After using the SOLIMOs for a while said I would update.  Here is the update.  I switched back to Gillette and cancelled my subscribe/save for Solimo.  For me the Gillette just works better as a razor.  I think everyone's face is a little different so I would encourage anyone to give the SOLIMOs as shot.  I was on the fence but based on shaving performance I prefer the Gillette and the price difference does not overcome that.ORIGINAL BOTTOM LINE:  I have 16 of these to try and about 20 Gillette still in the inventory so I'll toggle back and forth then update as necessary.  Based on the 50% of the cost for 80% of the capability formula WINNER:  SOLIMO...for now

I bought these razors as a budget alternative to my standard Gillette SkinGuard razors just for kicks and giggles. The new Amazon packaging is great and the extra cartridges are conveniently split 4 to a box which makes it great for storing.The handle- is nice. It fits well in the hand and the rubberized grip on the underside gives it a secure feeling. Not too much weight to it, but also not light. The only con about the handle, in my opinion, is the part that connects to the cartridge. It feels as though it’s going to break off with every stroke you take.The razors- not so great. I’m used to the SkinGuard razors which are pretty sharp straight out the package as every new razor should be. These razors straight out the package, felt like they had been used for a month before they were packaged. A lot of pulling and tugging on the initial stroke on short, post-shower facial hair. Gave it the benefit of the doubt, figured it was a dud and switched it out for another cartridge that was separately packaged and met the same result. During the shave, I even considered switching to a disposable Gillette Mens razor that I have for emergencies. I eventually finished the shave with a mediocre result.Another thing to note, the moisturizing strip doesn’t seem to mix well with all shave gels. I use Aveeno Therapeutic shave gel for sensitive skin, and for some reason it made it into a gummy mess and the strip seemed to be the culprit. No biggie, I rinsed off and used Cremo original shave cream and it seemed to be a whole lot better.All in all, you get what you pay for. It’s a budget razor with sub-standard results. I didn’t expect too much but it also under performed. If the sharpness was addressed this would easily be a five star product, given the amount of refills it comes with, but for now it’ll sit at a two star.

reviewTitle: Blades not as good as Gilette
reviewDescription: I tried this Amazon Basics razor to see if money could be saved with this private label razor. Unfortunately, the answer is no. The razor design is a good copy of Gillette razors, the blades are not of the same quality. For thicker facial hair, the blades are not as sharp as Gillette ProFusion blades, causing a slight tugging action even when new. This is exemplified more in the single edging blade on the back of the razor head. While a decent value, the extra money you pay for is the quality of the blades, which the Amazon Basics ones are not up to the task of cutting thick and/or coarse facial hair.

I figured these would be as good as Harrys but cheaper.I was wrong. When I got them, I wanted to compare them with Harrys. My first test was to run them dry down one cheek. I used a Harrys blade that was at about the end of  it's life. The old Harrys blade ran smoothly across the skin, even against the grain. I actually do dry shave with Harrys when in a hurry, and I've never gotten so much as  a nick.I tried the brand new Amazon blade and it repeatedly caught on hair. Even with shaving cream, it does not provide a smooth shave for me.There is no question in my mind now that Harrys is worth the extra money.The difference in quality is apparent too. Harrys blades are clearly much sharper. Looking closely at the two blades, I notice the Amazon individual blades were uneven. One seeme to have a slight curve in it. I'm sure this variance accounts for some of the hair pulling. The Harrys individual blades are perfectly even.The Amazon blades are not bad. I'll use up the ones I ordered. I just have to shave a bit differently with them so as not to catch the blade on my beard.But after that, I'm going back to Harrys. Do yourself a favor and compare whatever blade you use to Harrys.

I purchased these in December after having trouble sourcing blades for my usual razor. Reviews seemed OK, so I stepped out. After using for a few months, I will have to say they are just OK. Better than a cheap dollar store or bag of razors. My two main concerns are first shave comfort and quality of shave. The blades out of the box are not really sharp. They pull quite a bit... very painful in dense areas of your face. I use a hot towel and shave cream as usual prep. Second concern is quality. I have to go over some areas multiple times and directions to get this razor to shave completely. This is just my personal experience. Yours may be different. I suggest finding a razor brand that works for you. On a positive note... the blades are back in stock on the brand that works best for me. Best of luck to you 🤞

I bought these because they look similar to the Gillette fusions that I have been using but are prohibitally expensive. I've also tried Harry's Dollar shave Club and I believe Target has a brand, anyway, when I got these I believe there were 12 blades in the package with the shaver. First time I tried shaving with it was in the shower wet with shaving cream. I was not impressed by the shave at all. It seemed to pull at sometimes and I usually had to go over places two or three times. So I actually went back to the Harry's which I use on my face and I use this to shave my body meaning chest and arms which it does seem to work for that I would maybe give it a 3 out of five. Better for use on your body than your face

I liked the price compared to leading brands initially but it doesn’t measure up. I am a whole head shaver and for face only shavers it might be better. Trimmer blade is too deep. The swivel design is a complete fail and it may as well be a fixed blade. The handle lacks grip and is hard to hold. Blades are not quality of Gillette brands but better than Harry’s or Shave club. Price on this should be a bit lower or the quality should be better.

reviewTitle: Functional, but should be easier to change cartridges
reviewDescription: Razor works well enough, but the blade cartridges are really difficult to swap. The handle is black and the razor head is too, so it's difficult to see how to make the swap. (And which is the top vs. the bottom. I switched from years with DSC when they changed their razors. These work just as well, but I dread the weekly swap. Full confession, i buy the men's razors as they are less expensive and tend to work better. Please make them easier to snap in! Switched the "lady" version to see if the color difference between the base and cartridge makes it easier to execute. Probably not, but i hate wasting money on Gilette or other 'big brand' razors.

If you are someone that uses the trimmer on your razor, this is NOT the razor for you.  It's like using a dull blade to trim your sideburns or under your nose.  Hurt like a mother*&^&%$ using it for the first time because I was expecting it to be like one of the brands that I was hoping to replace this razor with.  Even through I'll pay more, I'm paying to save the skin on my face from being peeled off, because of a crappy trimming blade that doesn't perform well!!!!  BUYER BEWARE!!!If you are looking to just shave and not use the trimming feature, then you will be fine.

How do you make a razor for men that doesn't have the top part of the razor to trim the mustache right under your nose?The first time I used it, it did feel like it was going to cut me - but the blades do last, and there are a lot of them. It is cheap, I wish I went with a name brand. I had set to return these and just never got to it.

I have been a long-time user of Harry's 5-blade razors. I ordered these to see if I could find a similar shave and save money. As a bald man, I shave every other day. These blades are very dull in comparison to Harry's blades. The sharpness that these blades have also does not last long at all. I can only get about 2-3 shaves from one of these blades before the drag and pull is too uncomfortable. If you are a bald man looking for a comfortable shave from blades that last, this is NOT your razor.

I based the rating on fusion5 blades with fusion5 being the pinnacle of the blades.cons. this doesn't shave as close. it also rips into the skin substantialy more.pros. it has a significantly better edge trimmer. the price is fair. the blade stays sharp.they are good blades but they definitely are lacking if you are used to those expensive Gillette blades.

The last batch of these I got, out of the 2 sets of razors, the first set I got had ineffective razors, as the 2nd from the bottom razors were turned incorrectly. Whereas the razors were rendered unusable

reviewTitle: WIth my course hair these just didn't get the job done.
reviewDescription: I wanted these to liberate me from Gillette and save me money but being someone with course hair and prone to razor bumps these failed to perform to my standards. After shaving with these the exact same way I shave with the Gillette blades the first time I looked in the mirror a few hours later and noticed patches of hair that just didn't get cut well. I mean like I grabbed my razor and had to clean up because it looked sloppy. Also while cutting under my nose I had trouble getting close to my nose leaving hairs that I would of caught with Gillette single razor on the backside. I also shave my head and it seemed to do a good job but feeling my head the next day I felt the hair coming in alot sooner and patchier than with my Gillette blades. These just aren't as sharp. If you have pale thin hair these are probably a home run of savings but if you have course hair and have to deal with razor bumps look elsewhere.
Disappointed. I don’t have thick facial hair and the razors still pull my hair even when brand new.

This razor is hard to manage in getting into the various nooks and crannies of my beard. To be fair, I do have a heavier beard than most but I find that this razor is just too big. It is also frustrating to change the blades and they don't seem to last any longer than razors with fewer blades. I also don't think that it "cuts" any better. I am going back to a razor with three blades that is easier to use.

reviewTitle: The Price IS too good to be true
reviewDescription: I should've read the negative reviews first before purchasing because they are right.  I've been using this razor everyday for a week now and I am completely underwhelmed and unimpressed by it.I'm a long time Gillette/ Dorco Pace user and these Solimo blades feel like cheap dollar store razors in comparison.  As other reviews have mentioned, these Solimo blades do not provide a particularly clean close shave without a lot of effort and they take several passthroughs to get somewhat decent results.  And in the process of trying to get a closer cut, I found myself getting nicked a lot because of the extra (uneven) pressure needed to be applied or because these blades are simply too dull right out of the box.  I tried several of the cartridges so far to make sure it wasn't just a problem with the first one and they all had the same issue.My Dorco razors (and Gillettes) made shaving super quick and easy and I rarely ever cut myself with them even when the blade dulled down.  These Solimo blades are such a chore in comparison.  Very subpar.I guess the pricing and quantity bundled was simply because these are actually just dollar store razors wrapped in fancy packaging rather than Amazon trying to compete with the more established brands.I'm giving it 2 stars instead of 1 because at least the lubrication strip and pivot head work as designed.

reviewTitle: You get what you pay for.
reviewDescription: The razor doesn't work well - there is a dullness to the blade, even when you use it for the first time. It's better to spend more to get a good razor.

I really wanted to like this razor. It was a good price and is a good alternative, but it is just way too rough and hurts when I shave. It may be when I am working with one day stubble it will be okay, but a couple of days worth and it hurts like a son of a gun when I have shaved. I have had to keep an old Harry's razor next to me when I reach certain parts of my face because it just hurts too much with this razor on certain areas.

When Dollar Shave Club came out with their latest edition of razors and blades, I was worried by their new ratings.  So I decided to give Amazon brand a try.  The price was great, but you sometimes get what you pay for.  First shave I was very disappointed.  But I had some longer hairs as I hadn't shaved in a bit so I decided to give it a second try to see how these blades would do against my average growth.  After a single pass they get bogged down and begin to just glide over the hairs rather than cut them.  The photo says it all.  Nowhere close to as sharp as DSC and I can only imagine how much worse they would be from Gillette.  Alas, I cannot keep using these if my goal is to get a close shave.  Time to look elsewhere.

Used this product to shave my male face. The cartridge design is poorly thought. The rubber glides surrounding the blades are way to big and the overall width of the head is too large. If you have a square face with lots of straight lines this might work well. If you are older and a have a very round and wrinkly face this thing will cut and scrap you bloody every time. I am 50 years old and have been shaving for 34 years. I am giving up on cartridge razors and going back to the old fashion safety razor.The head is to wide and dose not swivel freely. because the blades are in the center of a huge rubber glide, you cannot get close to your nose or mouth. The head is not free enough to follow the curves of the chin either.This is just Amazon in a hurry to establish a brand for themselves. If they want to draw business to the site, they should only brand super high end items and sell them at a loss. Reputation is worth more that single item profit. When folks shop the site to get the amazon brand they will also buy everything else they need there as well. Even if Amazon takes a loss on a couple items, they will kick up overall sales.Amazon, hire me to brand marketing!!! Contact me!! I will show you how to truly corner every market you venture. Putting your name on cheap high profit junk items is not the way. I will take you places you cannot yet see!

reviewTitle: Don't buy not what one would hope for.
reviewDescription: I could only get 2-3 shaves from one blade.

I tried this because it seems like a good deal but it turns out you get what you pay for because the thing just feels cheap compared to the name brand I was using and doesn’t shave the same. Feels like it takes many more passes to get a clean shave and I will be going back to my pricier brand

reviewTitle: This is just not as good as my Gillette razor.
reviewDescription: This is just not as good as my Gillette razor.  used it.  Decided to not use it again.  Used it again by accident  and knew immediately it was not my Gillette.

I bought this razor as part of my search for a razor from a company that isn't Gillette or Harry's (for reasons I won't discuss here). My first shave was pretty good so I went ahead and bought some more blades for it. That is where my good experiences with this razor end.That first shave, from what I can figure, was good for 2 reasons: the blade was fresh and my stubble was short. I have incredibly thick and coarse facial hair, and it proved to be too much for these blades to handle for very long which is a huge disappointment considering I keep a beard most of the time so I only have to shave my neck and cheeks to shape the beard (I grow hair from right under my eyes down into my shirt so I have to shape my beard). Where I can get 5+ shaves with other brands before changing the blade, I have to change the blade on this razor with every shave. Even then, I found that if I wait a few extra days and my stubble is longer (not really stubble at this point), I have to go over the same area multiple times to get everything. That creates irritation, and I don't have that issue with better razors.This might work better for you. I'm a very hairy guy in his 40s with very dense facial hair. My face and neck feel like sandpaper just 3-4 hours after a shave with any razor. This razor did not pass the "can a Viking use this razor" test, LOL!

Took my first drive last night. It was kind of like driving a Yugo from the 90s.  It will get you there but not nearly as smoothly or as kindly as a top tier brand. I guess I'll have to use the cartridges, but probably won't buy again.  No cuts, just felt rough.
I’ve tried to give them a chance, I’m on my third blade. I have to shave over an area a few time and it’s still not a great shave. Would not purchase again

Tried the Amazon basics brand to save a little $, but I am not at all impressed with the quality and sharpness of these blades. I shave my head every 2-3 days, and with my usual well-known brand (rhymes with Larry’s), I get at least 5 good shaves per blade. I noticed these were not nearly as sharp on my first use, and only got 2 uses before blades felt extremely dull, despite cleaning the blades after each use with a toothbrush. I will not repurchase.

I am genuinely puzzled by these razor cartridges. I was enthused by all the positive reviews, and like everyone else, I thought Gillette cartridges seemed overpriced. I would have given up on Gillette years ago, except that there's nothing I hate more than an electric shaver.That's all changed now that I've gotten halfway through a box of these Solimo cartridges. The front side of the cartridge works fine for the price. I get a little more whisker pulling than I have come to expect with Gillette cartridges, but given the price differential, it's not that big a deal. It's on the back side of the cartridge, though, that Solimo really wets its pants. The single beard-trimmer blade looks enough like a razor blade, but in use it seems to have been designed to merely taunt the whiskers under my nose, yanking them painfully without actually cutting them. Although I have never actually had a Brazilian wax myself, I imagine the sensation must be pretty much the same.I threw the first cartridge away after one shave, assuming that I must've just gotten a bad cartridge. I've made it through several more now, and they all have the same useless single blade on the back. I now use two razors to shave: I'm determined to use up the rest of the Solimo cartridges, because, damn it, I've already paid for them. When it comes time to shave under my nose, though, I swear gently, set the Solimo down and use the Gillette to finish up. I don't know whether I got a bad box or whether I just have some freakish hellwhiskers under my nose, but when these Solimos are gone, I'll go back to Gillette. If someday they stop making Gillettes, maybe I'll get an electric shaver.

reviewTitle: It seems the blades have burrs on them
reviewDescription: The fact they seemed to burrs on the blades which nicked my skin more than once. I have never had this issue with another similar blade from a different manufacturer.
I have an issue with the cartridges falling off while shaving. Gave up on them and then tried again recently. Same issue. I was expecting better quality. Very disappointed.
Not a smooth shave.  It felt like it was pulling my hair mor so than cutting it.  After I was done I had more nicks than usual.  If I could return it I would.

These are subpar to Dollar Shave cartridges.Like everyone, I was attracted to the price point and the 5-blade design.  Unfortunately it shredded my skin in many places; I never bled with Dollar Shave. Additionally, what I thought was a single blade on the back side of the razor cartridge for trimming sideburns and under nose, instead, it barely curly any hair, but wathore pulled the hair, making it feel like sand paper and made me bleed.Not very impressed at all with these.
Do not save close and get cuts

I am going to write an honest review. My Solimo Blade arrived yesterday. Used it for the first time this am. Before I get into my review, allow to rate the razors that I have Trialed in order of preference.~Gillette Fusion5 is hands down the best on the market~Harry’s Truman is very good, but use caution. Blades very sharp, back one especially~Dollar Shave Club’s Truman isn’t quite as sharp, but safer. This is a great option.~Solimo 5-Blade Serves my needs. The back blade though is worthless. Don’t use it.These are listed in order of cost and my preference.01 June: as I stated I used the Solimo 5-Blade for the first time. I think it shaves ok. Wasn’t anything special, but for the value, I hope that I end up happy with it. The back single blade is absolutely worthless. Felt like dragging a dull rock across my face. I do have a separate razor that can do that job. So, I’ll be Trialing only the front 5 blades. Leave the back blade alone. Do not use it!02 June: used it again to shave my face and everything below my nexk. Yes, that means my pits, bits, and legs. If you look at the cartridge, the blades are recessed. So, it’s difficult to ascertain how sharp they are. No issues with my face shaving today, but the back blade trimming about my goatee is no bueno. I have my other shaver that can do that job. So, not an issue probably. Shaved my pits and legs with a pass or two. Nice and smooth. Just how I like it. More care with my bits obviously. Shaved my pubic area nicely, smooth as well. Happy with the overall results of these areas. No cuts, nicks, etc. Could well be worth it for this alone. Again, being as the blades are recessed, seems nearly, if not impossible draw blood.03 June: Overall, I am happy with how the Solimo 5-Blade shaves my face. It’s doing a good job. I was pleased with how it shaved my pits, bits, and lags. The back razor is absolutely useless for shaving around my goatee. I do have my other shaver that can do that. So, this is not a deal breaker.Overall…It’s a good razor for the value, and serves my needs. Shaves my face, pits, bits, and legs well. Back blade is absolutely pointless. rough and harsh on the skin; very dull. I will use my other shaver for my goatee. I hope this helps others.
Kinda goes dull fast but ok

reviewTitle: Not bad but... Get a Gillette Fusion ProGlide Instead! (Review)
reviewDescription: 50+ years of blade shaving, I've used them all, safety razors, disposables, etc. I used to be a Gillette guy, they gave the best shave: closest, very comfortable, good blade life. Unfortunately, Gillette's became more and more expensive to the point where I quit using them and looked for alternatives.For a long time, I used the Schick 5-blade cartridge razors. They worked well enough, not as good as Gillette, but adequate and far cheaper when Costco was selling them. They quit carrying them, and I found I could get cheap replacement cartridges from Amazon. Probably counterfeit, but initially, they were fine. Over several re-purchases, the cartridges got worse, where they weren't sharp to start with and dulled quickly. I started looking for alternatives.First I tried was this one, the Amazon Solimo. For shaving, about the same as the Schick before they went bad. The problem here was the trimmer. Other commenters have noticed the same thing, it just doesn't work well. Bad angle and a blade guard that makes it impossible to get close. On to the next one...Next, I tried Harry's, they're sold at Costco now. Again, about the same as the Schick used to be. Didn't care for how "floppy" the suspension of the blade were, but I could live with it. And I personally found the lubricant they use to be irritating, YMMV. But if the Solimo trimmer was bad, this one was worse. It should be labelled as a "lethal weapon". First time I used it I cut myself under my nose so bad it took 30 minutes to stop the bleeding. I never cut myself with my Schick, they have a flip-away moisturizer bar so that the full five blades can be used as a trimmer. Very comfortable and accurate. So, adios, Harry.Finally, I bit the bullet and ordered a starter pack of four blades and a handle, Gillette ProGlide. Yeah, they cost more, quite a bit more. But they're awesome. The shave is the closest and super-comfortable. No irritation from the lubricant. And the trimmer, while not as good as the Schick, is way better than the Harry's or Solimo. The correct angle and a very thin blade guard, works decently. The Gillette handle is also the best in your hand, good weighting and grip.So, don't waste your money, get Gillette. You'll pay more, but it's worth it.

UPDATE: I dropped this in the shower which tends to happen from time to time. One of the tabs that holds the blade on completely busted and now the handle is worthless. Poor designI've used so many different razors trying to find a brand where the razors don't dull quickly. I've tried Harry's, Gillette, and Joy, among others. Sometimes I'll buy men's razors bc they are usually less expensive per cartridge. So I decided to give Amazon razors a try after being disappointed by the other brands mentioned above. I've been very happy with Amazon basics razor blade refills. They stay sharp far longer than other brands I've tried which equates to a better shave and saved money in the long term. Thus far I'm very happy with the purchase and I thank Amazon for making a quality and affordable product.
Quantity good but very dull!
Even though the product provides a closer shave the brands like Gillette, the blades don't last but maybe 3 shaves when shaving a head and face. Would like it if the blades lasted longer than that.

reviewTitle: Received one less razor blade..16 instead of 17
reviewDescription: Haven't used it yet but wanted to mention that there are only 16 razors instead of 17... one of the cartridges have only 3 razors instead of 4 and one of attached to the handle..
The razor blade works well but the "precision trimmer" will not cut or trim and facial hair. It is difficult to see if there actually is a trimmer blade. Regardless it does not work.

These razors will give you a close shave. But you will be in agony while you're getting it. The blades are set at such an aggressive angle that it feels like shaving with broken glass to shave with these razors. I can't recommend these razors if you want a comfortable shave. But if a close shave is all you care about, they will do the job,

The only positive point about this product is that the handle is, indeed, a well-built, metal handle with some heft to it.  Feels great and is non-slip.  But, that's where the positive ends.The razor cartridges are not doing it for me — i.e., not giving a close shave at all.  I actually get just about as good (maybe better) from my electric!  It's perfectly suitable for underarms, which is the only reason I didn't request a return.  But, I'd never recommend it for someone wanting a silky-smooth face.  I'm going back to Bic or Gillette.

The blades on this razor drag and result in a very uncomfortable shave. I was very disappointed since I was hoping to find a razor that would replace the three blade Gillette Mach 3 I have been using. But this is not worth the savings in my book. I'm glad I only ordered the sample kit!

reviewTitle: Great while it lasted - and then it wasn't
reviewDescription: Excellent shave for  8 out of the 16 blades. Then the handle refused to attach to any of the remaining blades. I was really looking forward to continuing with this system, until it did not work. Yes, my Gillette Mach 3 and Fusion razors have been expensive, but the handles have lasted forever.

I thought maybe I could finally find a cheaper razor blade that felt as good shaving as my more expensive Gillette blades. This isn't it. The brand new blades feel duller than my 2 week old Gillette blades.Whoever supplies Amazon with these is probably selling them their rejects.

Not sure why this razor gets good reviews. It might be okay for a womans legs. The five blade design is a bad idea, the blade stays clogged. Had to spend twice the time shaving just trying to keep the blade clean. Will not buy anymore.

I hot these cause I wanted to use something more then a throw away razor. And these last just as long and give me razor burn. They don't really hit all the spot. It's kind of sad. The price is nice and that's about it

I gave it a try, but I regret spending the money… I don’t feel like using them because they leave hair behind and also had irritation in my skin. It has have good value for the quality, but was a waste of my money

Read the reviews and gave these razors a shot.  The 5 blade design looked similar to fusion but the shave is no better than you get from any cheap razor.  Stubble and irritation is what is left behind.

This was not my firs time ordering these but will be the last.  Every other blade I choose is the dullest I have ever had in my life.  Might as well be using a cheese grater or a dull knife on my face.  Stick with name brand.  Its called Amazon Basic, not Amazon Best for a reason.

when it comes to razor blades cheaper is not better. I have used several different brands of blades. they are expensive so naturally im trying to find a cheaper blade with that might compare. I saw these amazon blades and thought i would give them a try. Unfortunately, they are not what they seem to be. no longevity, and blades are inconsistent. also trying to snap blade to razor itself is a challenge. sorry amazon. sometimes you just have to bite the bullet and buy name brands.

reviewTitle: Adequate but not quite as good as Gillette brand.
reviewDescription: Blades are sharp and everything is well made but it just feels like a cheap knockoff of a Gillette. The clipping system isnt as smooth and easy as a Gillette and takes a little fiddling to get right. The blades give a close and smooth shave but has a tendency to tug on my hair, which I only see after extended use on other, more expensive blades. Overall, I would recommend this to daily shavers or those with thin hair.

reviewTitle: tldr: Just meh. Not as good as DSC; I'll be going back to them.
reviewDescription: So, I'm a woman, and I have long bought men's razors primarilly for the price difference, but also because I don't need (or want) pink puffy everything in my life simply because of my gender--what an annoying assumption. Anyway, I tried dollar shave club a couple years ago, and ended up canceling when I had about a year's worth (or more) of razors stocked in my cabinet (shoutout to all the other ladies out there who pretty much just shave their pits, and bikini lines in between waxings. To everyone else, if my quarterly leg-shave is too hairy for you, I invite you to stop looking at my legs). Well, after my stockpile of DSC was all used up, I tried this Amazon brand, since I've discovered that I pretty much will stick with any product if I like it enough AND it can be auto-delivered to me (seriously, who buys toilet paper in person anymore? Get that biz shipped to you and score the subscription discount, too).Immediate verdict with literally the first swipe of this razor: Inferior. It slightly pulls at my hair, and doesn't even run smoothly over just-shaved skin. Did it give me razor burn? No. Did it murder my pits or bikini line? No. Was the handle also inferior to DSC? Yes, but not in a way that I couldn't have ignored it if the razors themselves had been better. But for me, my pits & binki line are too precious to be dragging a sub-par razor over them every other(ish) day. With DSC, I could use the same razor for a month (I have fine hair, fyi), and it never pulled even after all that use. Anyway, I'll be going back to DSC; those folks have figured out how to make a decent razor AND auto-ship it to me--take my money.
It's a razor.  With five blades it clogs and difficult to clean.  Not just this razor, but others too.  Less is  more
Didn't provided a close shave. Had to spend more time going over areas multiple times to really get comfortable shave and no patches or stubble.

reviewTitle: Good shave, Precision trimmer rough on skin
reviewDescription: Very good razor for the most part. Excellent price and value. The precision trimmer blade is very rough on my skin though.
The latch attachment for the blade to complicated this has to be easy as you are dealing with sharp blade.

I have purchased other Amazon Basics products with mixed results. 5 stars for the freezer storage bags and 3 stars for these blades. The reasons are simple; there is no trimmer blade (if there is, I can't see it. Trying to shave with this blade is painful so don't try using it without your first aid kit at hand. As well, the 5 blade side is nothing to write home about. Definitely more "pull" with these blades and while not painful, they don't provide a pleasurable shaving experience. After 3-4 shaves, they are done so at the end of the day I am spending more for these blades than I pay for premium blades. Not sure what those blue strips are supposed to do but they deon't seem to be positively impacting my shavling experience. Overall, can't recommend these blades due to the above serious deficiencies.

I have to maintain a close shave for work which means I shave a few times per week.  I have been using the gillette fusion 5 or proglide for years, and I think those are top tier razors for getting a true close shave.The Amazon basics is very similar to the Gillette, and by no means is it a bad razor.  It does not get as close of a shave as the gillette, but it works great.  I am happy to use the rest of the razors that came with the handle, but I don’t think I would keep buy refills.  I think this handle would be good if you wanted to keep a backup or something like that.All in all, I’d probably give it a 6/10

Been useing these Amazon blades now for almost 2 months. I still use my Gillette too. The Gillette 1month old blade still is a smoother shave, but at a higher price for sure. The Amazon is also more difficult to change blades, I'm still having problems after this much time. I'm still looking for a better price for Gillette.  Still looking for a better buy than Gillette, The Amazon in't cutting it.I'm now trying a Bic razor, it's smooter than Amazon, still not as good as Gillette. Found a better buy on Costco .com so I'm switching from Bic to Gillete now.
Razors felt coarse against the skin -- unsure why, but made for a very uncomfortable shave. I will go back to using another brand. This is not a high quality product.

reviewTitle: Ok shave, but almost impossible to get on the handle
reviewDescription: The shave these blades offer is not bad. Nothing great, but not bad. The problem is that it's next to impossible to get the blades on the handle.  After several tries, I finally gave up and had to pry the cartridge out of the holder and then carefully align the handle on the cartridge to get it on.  Frankly, that's way too much work for a decent but not great shave. More than likely I won't be buying these things again.

I have been using Mach3 blades for years and like them.  The price on these blades was the reason I gave them a try.  I just can't get a good close shave with them.  The blades don't seem as sharp as the Mach3s, and they are spaced too close together.  If I worked at it I could get a shave that was close to the Mach3s but it took twice as long, took twice the effort, and was still uneven.  The blades sometimes seemed to pull rather than cut the hairs.  A minor detail is I couldn't even reach some hairs under my nose.  I wanted to like them, but after using about half I've given up.  They are now in a drawer in case I have nothing else to shave with.

I used Harry’s razors for years and decided to try a more affordable option since the refills are so much cheaper for the Amazon brand. I was disappointed, I didn’t get as good as a shave as Harry’s does and I feel like I have to replace the razor head faster than the Harry’s brand so it’s really not cheaper in the end. The handle is nice quality and gets the job done but spend the extra money on a name brand!

reviewTitle: We all came here for one thing - Price
reviewDescription: Bought these because of the outrageous price for replacement catridges for my Gillete fusion.  Saw the price and the thousands of reviews and thought I would give it a try.  How hard can it be - they are just razors.  The blades from 10-15yrs ago were longer lasting and just as sharp than Gillete Fusion for 1/2 the price. Old school tech shouldn't fleece us!So I give these a try.  The first shave felt pretty good to be honest.  Bit of a learning curve, but pretty happy  with the value.  I go to my next shave with same blade and woah - felt like I was getting a tatoo removed from my neck.  Switch blades thinking I did something wrong or damaged and while better still felt like the blade had sand in it.  The single blade on other side is borderline criminal for trimming sideburns and under nose area.  Unsure what I'm doing wrong or how this blade is oriented to feel like I'm inserting a laser into sensitive skin under nose. .Mfg needs to improve the blade longevity - or perhaps that is their "model" to make users have to dispose of the blades 2x as fast to make more profits.Handle and everything else is fine, but lets be honest - we only care about the shave and value.

reviewTitle: Painful Shave That Destroyed My Face - AND Left Stubble!
reviewDescription: I really REALLY wanted these to be great, but they really hurt me and weren’t very effective. And the precision trimmer on the back side is downright painful and unusable to clean up the area directly below my nose. Really too bad as I prefer the handle over the Gillette.And the fact that they’re half the price ain’t too bad either!But the dry cleaning bills to get my blood off my dress shirts would more than make up for that.I guess they’re getting returned. Bummer.

From the outer look, it was the original Gillette I knew and used for a long time. To my dismay, I discovered that it was something cheap. I tried to return it, but unfortunately, the window is closed. I ordered it while I was abroad traveling.

Here is a very honest review of the 5 blade Solimo men's razor and comparison based on multiple shaves under different stubble lengths.  I currently have used the "Caveman" razor from ShaveMOB for several years with really no complaints.  It shaves very well, has outstanding longevity (usually 3-4 weeks per blade), and great service.  The cavemen is identical to the Solimo razor as it has 5 blades and the rear precision trimmer blade.  Under normal shaving conditions, it seems that the Solimo razor takes two or three additional passes to what the ShaveMOB razor would do.  While the Solimo razor does have the "motionsphere" head, this basically does nothing for me and has no effect good or bad while shaving.  Where the Solimo is lacking even more is the rear precision trimming blade.  The ShaveMOB trimming blade was just as useful to me as the front side and did an outstanding job under the nose, corners or the mouth, and sideburns.  The Solimo trimming blase is basically useless.  It does not trim well as all and after multiple skin irritating tries, I give up and have stubble left in those areas.  The ultimate deal breaker was when I used a disposable 3 blade Rite Aid brand razor at work that worked better than the Solimo.  I highly recommend trying the two cartridge pack of Solimo and giving it a test run before making the mistake that I made and buying the 16 razor pack.  I will be paying just a little more and re-ordering the ShaveMOB Cavemen this week and giving the rest of my Solimo razors away as it just doesn't work well enough for me.  I was gonna give a third star due to the value pricing, but not worth it if it doesn't work well.

I tried these to replace my defender razor, but it’s not as good. I like the sturdy handle and sharp blades, but I can’t shave the small area under my nose with this. Also, getting used to it took a minute because I cut myself multiple times and didn’t realize it until I was out of the shower. On a scale from 1-5: I rate these a solid 2.

I sought out a new razor for shaving my head when even the most expensive cartridge razors from Gillette were struggling to get through my thick hairs.This was no different.At first I thought this was a hidden gem, like many reviews stated.Not only did I learn that it’s not the razor’s fault that my hairs are so thick, but also that this blade has a knack for cutting SKIN.I’ve never in my life used a razor with a head so poorly designed. Each of the two times I used this blade (gave it a fair shot) I ended up cutting my head open in at least three places, which I’d never experienced before with other razors!I don’t recommend this blade personally, but others here swear by it.
Clunky, tough to shave close to nose. Anti abrasion strip seems to melt off and cover top blade.
It just didn’t provide an easy, smooth shave and the blade didn’t last as long as anticipated.
Returned these (thanks Amazon!)  as they were useful for two shaves only. I was hopeful they were made by a big name and could save money but that's not the case.
A lot less money than brand name but blades are dull after two uses.

I've used other brands of this type of razor, and replacing the blades was easy. Just take the old one off, slip the thingee into the thingee, click, and away you go. There aren't any instructions beyond what you see on Amazon. I'm surprised no one else has mentioned this previously.

The product may seem like a good value, which it is in comparison to other brands, but I would not purchase again unless changes were made to razor design.  Yes, it does produce a good amount of lubricant to help with the shaving process, but it is excessive; making it harder to shave. In addition, either the angle of the razor is off or the thick lubricant attachment makes it harder to get an efficient smooth shave.  I had to repeatedly go over the same spot due to a design flaw. Lastly, the single blade for close shave was also hard to use around the nose, again, possibly due to the lubricant bar sitting near the blade. I will stick to Gillete for now until the design with the Amazon brand is modified and shaving process is not such a hassle.

Let me start off by saying I don't have a lot of hair and it's VERY thin and I do not have sensitive skin. I typically buy big name brands but figured I would give this one a try, save some money. Well... you get what you pay for. I went through a full pack in a month and a half which for me is terrible the last time I bought a big pack of Gillette from Sam's club it lasted me an entire year,... again thin hair, not much of it. To make matters worse I haven't had razor burn since I started shaving this one brought it all back.. Does it get the job done yes, affordable yes, would I buy it again no. With as fast as I'm going through these I would much rather pay the extra and get big brands that actually work and still save money technically because I'm not blowing through blades.
I was disappointed in the quality of the blades for this shaver.  Either they don't last long (2 to 3 shaves only) or they were dull from the beginning.
2 stars because the razor and the blades look and feel high quality. But these things are terrible. Not a close shave, and leave razor burn. Wouldn’t recommend at all.

I had high hopes for Amazon's brand shaver. I finally thought I found something comparable to my Gillet 5+1 blade razor. They have gotten so expensive even on here. Unfortunately, the 1-star reviews were right. There is a single blade on the back, but it's pretty much non-existent. It pulls more than it does anything. Completely useless. Secondly, my wore out Gillet shaves better and closer than this razor does out of the box. It's painful. And then lastly, there is not two lubricated pads as they claim. There is one on the top which is very slick (too slick). It's darn near sticky coating your face and the bottom is just a rubber strip. I'm glad I only ordered the two pack, otherwise I'd be returning it. As of now, I'll use and dispose of it. I've already order a Gillet replacement. Amazon... back to the drawing board on this one.

reviewTitle: After 46 years of shaving, I finally found as close to perfect as possible
reviewDescription: I am turning 59 next month and I started shaving when I was 13. The men in my family have tough and fast-growing beards. Shaving has always been a crappy job with crappy results... until I found Amazon Basics 5-Blade MotionSphere Razor in combination with Cremo Barber Grade Original Shave Cream.Stop spending a fortune on the name brand razors. These razors are superior in quality and shave and dramatically less expensive. I've been using them for a few years how and could not be happier with the closeness of the shave, how long they last, and the amazing price point compared to the rip-off that the major shaving brands are.After shaving, my face is smooth and clean, and my wife loves the results. Yours will too.I highly recommend using these with the Cremo Barber Grade Original Shave Cream. The combination of these two products has made for the best shaves I've had in 4 decades of shaving.Trust me, you will love this razor and you will love the money you still have in your pocket. It works flawlessly, lasts a long time, and is much cheaper than the name brands and works better than any of them.Pro shaving tips from 4 decades of shaving:Never shave upwards. When you do, you are pulling the hairs up and back and that causes them to invert and causes bumps. It may seem like you are getting a closer shave, but you are actually causing issues you have to deal with longer term. Just keep shaving on a downward stroke only.After you lather your face up, let it sit. The longer it is on, the more pliable/softer your beard hairs will be and will make shaving much easier and closer.Rinse your blade constantly. Every time you stroke the blade on your face, rinse the blade. Haris are stuck between the blades and they prevent you from getting a close shave.When rinsing your blade, place the blade at the bottom of the falling water. Gravity and propulsion gives it more force to remove the hairs stuck between the blades.Rinse both sides of the blade, not just one side, so you make sure to get the hairs out from in-between.After shaving, dry the blades on your towel. Your blades will last much longer. Don't put the blades in a box or bag. Just leave it out to dry faster.Hope this helps. Happy shaving!Love,Brad

I've been using the Amazon Basics 5-Blade Razor Refills for a few weeks now, and I couldn't be happier with the results. These cartridges fit perfectly onto my Amazon Basics razor handle, making it incredibly convenient to swap them out when needed.The five blades provide a close and precise shave, leaving my skin feeling incredibly smooth without any irritation or nicks. The dual lubrication ensures a comfortable glide with each stroke, reducing friction and allowing for a seamless shaving experience.What I appreciate most about these refills is their longevity. Each cartridge lasts for several shaves, which makes this pack of eight cartridges an excellent value for the price. I no longer have to worry about constantly purchasing replacement cartridges, as this pack keeps me stocked up for months.Overall, I highly recommend the Amazon Basics 5-Blade Razor Refills to anyone looking for a reliable and affordable shaving solution. Whether you're a daily shaver or someone who prefers a few times a week, these cartridges deliver consistent and impressive results every time.

There razors are worth it! I have been using them for years. Very sharp and last a long time! There leave soft skin and get a very close shave. Also better price then in other places. Just be careful over bony prominences, very sharp.

As you can tell, we just bought our first Amazon branded razor and it blew DSC out of the water (no pun intended).When DSC was purchased by Unilever one of the first things they did was kill their app.  I mean why not? Convenience is lame anyway.Next, they switched up their blades and handle to a cheap, flimsy, and easy-to-break knockoff of what they once were.Okay, now on to the best thing about this razor. SINGLE PASS GOODNESS!  Whether taming the Netherglades or cleaning up the back 40, this baby has you covered. No more attempting thirty different angels to try and catch that one spot that reminds me of my ex-husband - short, inconvenient, and prickly.I will be purchasing a second handle for my husband and we’ll be adding this to our Amazon subscription service !

reviewTitle: Flabbergasted - (pics of my ugly mug for shaving illustration only)
reviewDescription: I am stunned by all the shaving culture diatribe.  I am 47 years old and have been actively shaving for more than 3 decades.  That beautiful beard of mine is something that I maintain for about 5 months per year.  From a clean shave to 3 weeks of not shaving it is fully in, but for length.  Point is,  I grow a thick beard, fast.Now, 7 months out of the year I shave that thick, fast growing beard, along with my entire head and neck - clean.  Until a few years ago I did this every day and wore a suit as a practicing attorney (I'm now blessed with my days filled with homeschooling my kids, working heavy machinery to make pasture for a developing farm, and generally staying out of public).In ALL of these years I barely ever thought about how "enjoyable" my private-"me"-shave time was, or how special and pampering my equipment was.  Fact is, I'm a fair-skinned white guy with thick facial hair and moderately sensitive skin.  I used the regular progression of Gillette razors and marveled at how many blades were being added to my cartridges (I'm waiting for the "Razor Washcloth" where you wipe your entire face, etc. with  a cloth covered in 1,000 razors that spin, wiggle, gyrate and sing Elvis songs for your most enjoyable 3 minutes per morning rush).One day I heard about man-shaming, corporate-s'plaining from Gillette and assessed my shaving costs.  Here's my set up:  razor + Lever 2000 that I wash my entire ... me ... with.  That's it.  Lever is pennies per week, Gillette ...??? Why was I so heavily invested in this company, were there good alternatives I mused? Hence my introduction to all this panty-wasted shave-culture gibberish (stick with me to hear support for this conclusion).I nearly got completely freaked out by considering a new razor.  I imagined chunks of my tender flesh on the shower floor due to unknown shaving follies, calls to the fire department to please put out this unbearable burning, and aliens just saying "ahhh, screw it, let's stop wasting time and 86 these puny life-forms; this guy's shaving mishaps have completely caused us to loose faith of any redemption for the bugs!"Seriously, the discussion was nearly crippling. Don't get me wrong, I lived for years in  Chicago area group homes, etc.  with some black guys who really had to take care with their products or they'd get some bad ingrowns, etc. But these were the outliers, NOT the norm out of all the guys I've known in nearly half a century!Finally, I overcame internet-info-overload and picked this razor (Solimo 5 blade).  It arrived and I found myself comparing it closely to the Gillette - STILL due to the online discussions.  I'd say the docking mechanism on the Gillette seems stronger (although I don't normally engage in Fencing with my razor, no matter the make), and the back of the Gillett cartridge doesn't have the additional horizontal support that the Solimo does (which then catches some additional debris - but, I just don't take out my unsightly razor and show it off to guests anyway so ... meh).Shaving ... IT SHAVES!  Like ... a RAZOR!!! I got a few tiny pinpoint knicks by my lip the first time or 2 because it's not identical to the Gillete I was used to, but by use 4 or so, I don't notice any big difference to shaving with my Gillette. And I've been shaving my head, neck, and face with this thing (meaning the same, 1st cartridge) for over 5 weeks now.Also, I hang the thing in my shower.  I don't rub it on fancy pads.  I don't blow it out, fluff it, polish it, sing to it, or coddle it in anyway.  I grab this servile hunk of plastic, thrust it under the water and start unceremoniously scrubbing my many areas of skin with it in generally rough and crude fashion until I am slick and smooth as the day I was born and then rinse off, towel off and start putting out all the proverbial fires that my 4 young kids have started up while I dared take 5 minutes in the shower.Seriously, my process is: wash the body; rub Lever 2000 soap suds on head, neck and face; grab razor hanging on shower wall and stick under water; drag that thing unjudiciously this way and that way with and accross the hair grain on my head; finish head with reapeated little scrubbing actions (like rubbing adhesive off a table with your finger tip) against the hair grain to get the skin really smooth; repeat all of this with the face; judicious and sensible force and motion on my neck - come on now, I'm not a beast.And that's it.  And after more than 5 weeks of this I was still getting ... o.k. results with my very first Solimo cartridge. BUT, being so cheap I ended up switching out to a new one today because there's no reason not to.  The new blades didn't nick me once - so, I've adjusted my technique.  I noticed the greater efficiency with the new blade, but my gosh, seriously this has got to be number 47,953 in importance out of the top 45,000 important things in my life.So, now that I've finished my journey down this rabbit hole, my conclusion is the Solimo is fine (as are most other shaving products, likely) and the shave-culture is a panty-waisted thing.  Just one beast's opinion.Update 3/3/21:  It's been a couple of years now and I'm still using the same system.  This is nuts, but I believe I've only changed the head 5 or 6 times (tops) in that time.  I did add one additional "trick" to what I do.  I keep a spent toothbrush in the shower and give the razor head a little back and forth scrub before I shave and once during the shave (usually when I'm finished with my head and move to my neck, then face).  Otherwise, every single thing I said above remains my experience.  My wife even converted on those sweet, smooth, soft legs of hers and I'm fine with Solimo's results there too (and, let's be honest, if I'm not going into the office, or before a judge, the smoothness of her legs is FAR more important to me than that of my noggin', neck, or mug). Thumbs up and recommendations for Solimo 2 years after switching from "Girllete".

I hate shaving. I don't grow facial hair super quickly (no 5 o'clock shadow here). As such, I usually wait a couple of days to shave when my facial hair is a little longer. That way it seems to shave cleaner and smoother. However, I can't always do that and usually when I shave every morning I get small cuts, even with the best of blades and cream.Enter Amazon's blades! I don't know how these are different from others. I swear they have to be a white label from something(?), but they just work better. They are cheaper. They include many more replacement blades. And I haven't had a cut yet. I'm sure it will happen, that is inevitable. However, I don't feel the same resistance and "tug" while using these. Short stubble, long stubble, doesn't matter. I even shaved short stubble with no cream (dry shave) and it worked just fine.I would give these a 5++ if I could. You won't regret buying these... at least I don't.

reviewTitle: Uses the same blades Goodline Grooming
reviewDescription: These blades and the handle are fine, and are the same as some of the low-cost blades available at my local pharmacy.  These are identical to Goodline Grooming blades, with one exception.  There is no single trimming blade on the back side of the Amazon blades, which is a huge improvement.  I tend to cut my nose when shaving with the Goodline blades, but not the Amazon. They last just fine and I'm getting about two weeks out of each blade. The only downside is that, like the Goodline blades, it's hard to get a blade out of the plastic blade holder.  I have to pry them out with a pair of scissors.

reviewTitle: Possibly my new favorite disposable razor
reviewDescription: I am put you might call a shaving veteran. I have a heritage that is fairly conducive to hair growth 🤣🤣🤣 in other words I'm a hairy guy and my facial hair grows really rapidly and started growing in when I was quite young, 12 years old or so. So I've been shaving for a very very long time and I've used just about every product I have encountered.Gillette has always been my favorite in terms of comfort and durability, but the price is absolutely ridiculous. It's criminal actually.I switched to Dorco blades about a decade ago and they serve me really well. Dorco provides or at least used to provide blades for a lot of well-known brands and you could get those blades direct from Dorco for quite some time, which I did. The quality and price were unbeatable. Couple years ago that changed, I think they changed their business model and stopped offering DTC (direct to consumer) sales or at least made a very challenging to find how to order directly.Anyway that led me to try in a whole crop of new blade brands and most were failures or at least not what I was looking for. Many of them had really dramatic changes to the blade angles or the spacing and that caused all sorts of issues for me and the way I shave, so I continued on the quest to find something comfortable. I really ended up liking a few different blades the Creamo brand was one that I really liked. Harry's was decent, but it really forced me to change my shaving style too much and if I went back to muscle memory you can forget about the skin on my face I was all torn up.I haven't had a ton of success with Amazon branded products, but the price was right on these blades and they looked similar to Gillette so I thought I'd give him a try. Turns out this is my new favorite blade. I have tons and tons of other blades to get through. Probably 2 years worth, but I don't know that I'll ever get through those other blades cuz I keep replacing them with new Amazon blades.Anyway this topic might not be interesting to some, but if you do shave and you are particular about how you shave and you're looking for a disposable rather than straight razor or safety razor or something, these are definitely worth giving a try in my opinion.

Well worth the purchase for the cost. Provides a shave that matches most of the expensive 3-5 blade razors on the market.Pros: heavier handle, good quality, well packaged, good shave, low costCons: cannot purchase blades only

reviewTitle: Amazon Basics is more than Basic
reviewDescription: What I like about this Razor is that it feels just like when I was using Gillette. My face didn't break out like when I uses Schick or Harry's.The handle on this Razor is also well balanced.And all of this at a great price.

reviewTitle: Great Value, But Not High-End Performance
reviewDescription: I recently purchased the 5-blade razor due to its attractive price point. In terms of value, it's definitely a winner. However, when it comes to comparing it with some of the higher-end Gillette razors I've used in the past, it falls a bit short in terms of shaving performance.On the positive side, this razor offers an excellent bang for your buck. The five blades provide a close shave, and I appreciate that it comes with multiple cartridges in the package. The handle is comfortable to hold and has a solid grip, making it easy to maneuver during shaving.Where this razor doesn't quite match up to the more premium options is in the overall shave quality. While it does get the job done and leaves my skin fairly smooth, I did notice a few instances of missed hairs and the need for more than one pass in certain areas. The shave also doesn't feel as effortless and precise as some of the higher-end Gillette razors that I've tried before.If you're on a budget and looking for a practical razor that gets the job done without breaking the bank, this 5-blade razor is definitely worth considering. However, if you prioritize an exceptionally smooth and effortless shave, you might find that some of the pricier options from Gillette offer a more superior shaving experience.In conclusion, the 5-blade razor offers great value for its price, but it may not match up to the shaving prowess of some higher-end Gillette models. It's a decent option for everyday use, especially if you're looking to save some money, but keep in mind that there are trade-offs in terms of shaving performance.

reviewTitle: ONE OF MY FEW GOOD REVIEWS
reviewDescription: I've been a single blade razor user for about 5 years.  I also shave my head.  Anyone who shaves their head will tell you shaving the back of your head is a tricky endeavor with a double-edged safety razor without cutting yourself.  I've always kept a Gillette Fusion 5 disposable handy for days when I am either in a hurry or need to shave my scalp quickly as cutting yourself with a disposable 5 blade razor is pretty difficult.That being said, Fusion 5 blades are really good but also really expensive.These Amazon Basics 5-Blade MotionSphere Razor is every bit as good as the Gillette Fusion 5 but WAY less expensive.  They are inexpensive enough that I may stop using my double-edged razor soon.  The shaver is very close, comfortable and inexpensive.  The ONLY CON is that the stubble that gets in between the blades does not rinse out as easily as the Gillette Fusion 5 blades.

I've always been a gillete fusion kinda girl, but its gotten a bit too expensive to keep up with. Im one that keeps the razor in the shower, so I found that the blade strip "conditioner" fades out too soon for what I was paying with gillete. Im super happy about this alternative. The shaves are still very clean, but always use a good shave gel and whatnot to keep the life of your razors running strong. 0 complaints other than I find hairs being stuck in between the blades more easily with Amazon brand...but you can work with that by rinsing your blades out more often while shaving. Worth the purchase!

I switched to Amazon Basics brand after trying Great Value (Walmart).The other brand left me with nicks and cuts all over my head. After switching to Amazon Basics brand I had no more cuts, even shaving over the nicks and cuts the Walmart brand left me with.

They work just fine. Gives me a close shave on a brand new razor. But that’s the thing you need to remember; they go dull pretty fast compared to a Gillette. I shave twice a week. After that, it’s time to change it. If you don’t, you can expect it to start pulling on your hair and irritating your skin. Keep that in mind, and you’ll get good use out of them.

The first-time husband used he said this razor pulled quite bad on face and was not sure if it was a bad blade. It was quite painful. But was hoping after continuing use it was going to let up which it has. A lot more cost efficient than name brand razors/blades in the store.  Economical.

Overall, this is a pretty decent razor. It shaves well, comes with a generous amount of replacement heads, and has a decent weight. Only gripe I have with it is that the handle isn't a solid metal piece... the top is hollow and makes it feel cheaper than other razors I have used.

The 5 blade portion of the razor is great. Very similar to the name brand razor I have used for years. The handle is just as comfortable as the competitor. The bad part is the trimmer blade. It is basically useless. Does not cut well or close at all. If they would fix this, it would be a 5 star rating.
There’s a lot of similarity to the actual Gillette and so forth. I find them extremely suitable and comfortable for the price and will continue to pursue using them.
It’s not as good as the Gillette razor but it is descent

I decided to see if the Amazon razor would make me ditch my Gillette ProGlide.  I took a new Amazon head, a new ProGlide head, lathered up my face and went to work.  It had been 3 to 4 days since I shaved last and I had some decent fuzz going.The first swipe with the ProGlide set the bar, a nice easy pull down and the hair was gone.  Next I grabbed the Amazon, went to the opposite side of my face in the same spot and...ouch, ouch, ouch!  The Amazon razor felt like it was trying to pull the hairs out instead of cutting them.  It also left more hair after the first pass than the ProGlide did.I went swipe for alternating swipe with each razor and I'm not picking up the Amazon razor again.  They don't cut as well and I really dislike the pulling.  I'm sticking with the Gillette ProGlide.Just to make sure it wasn't only my opinion I took the second new Amazon blade, a new ProGlide, and gave them to my wife to try on her sensitive areas.  She had the same remarks and doesn't want to use the Amazon razor anymore either.  She asked me to order her a set of her own ProGlides.Gillette: 👍Amazon: 👎
Bargain price but cut more like a 3 blade system. Does not provide a clean close shave. You might need a septic pencil. Overall just average.
my shaving blade keeps falling off handle making it almost unusable.  I feel it is a poor design for shaving blade and handle.

reviewTitle: Good razor blades. However, they could be much better!!!
reviewDescription: I've been using Gillette razors for more than 30 years. They the only ones that, I believe, can efficiently give me a close shave. I've tried many other brands and have been mostly disappointed.When I saw these Amazon brand of razor blades (Solimo), and given their price, I immediately wanted to give them a try. I ordered them.Unlike Harry's razor, the Solimo razor doesn't look and feel cheap. The handle is not as bulky as that of some other brands. In fact, it is only slightly larger than that of the Gillette Fusion. The blades are sharp. However, achieving a close shave with them, such as with those of the Gillette Fusion Gillette Fusion, is difficult. In my opinion, it is because of the design of the cartridge ... This can be improved as described in the following suggestions:1) The Solimo cartridge is about 3 mm larger than the Gillette Fusion's. This extra width is due to the relatively large lubricating strip on the front and the bulky "protective" guard strip on the back. They could be slimmed down.2) The metallic protective guards on the side of the cartridge are about 1/3 of a mm higher from the blades on the Solimo than on the Gillette Fusion.3) The angle of vertical rotation of the handle over the cartridge is about 65 degree on the Solimo, while it's about 80 degree on the Gillette Fusion. This is, IMO, an easy fix by partly shaving off the three stoppers (two on the side and one in the middle) on the Solimo cartridge.I believe that if these three issues are taken care of as I suggest, these Solimo razor blades could come close to producing a shave as close as that of the Gillette Fusion. At this point, they deserve 3 stars.
I seem to be kicking myself a little more with these than bigger brands. But they do get the job done

I wanted to like these blades, but after using several, the comfort strip only worked on one blade.  I can’t get the comfort strip to activate at all on these blades.  Also, if I go 3-4 days without shaving, these blades require a very, very soapy slick lather or they tear at my whiskers.  In fairness, on this point, I have a very tough beard.

reviewTitle: Okay Razor Blades , but not for Sensitive Faces
reviewDescription: I have purchased these razors in hope to find a reasonable price and quality razor.  I used to use DSC razors for many years and within the recent year or two, I noticed a significant decrease in the quality of DSC razors, most likely switched vendors, thus I switched to Amazon’s brand.What caught my eyes about these blades was the number of reviews and ratings (If they are true).  I was impressed at the rating and price, thus my purchase.I should mention that my face is sensitive w/ coarse facial hair and I use shaving butter when I shave.  That said, I can tell immediately when the quality of a blade drops to the point of needing to be replaced, otherwise, razor burns and ingrown hairs result.As for these razor blades, they are great at first use and okay at second use, then immediately the quality of the blades are reduced to subpar  compared to DSC and Gillette.All in all, I would recommend these razor blades for only the people who do not have sensitive skin.

reviewTitle: Not terrible but not good enough. Won't buy again!
reviewDescription: Average at best. I need better quality, better blades. I'm guessing these are made from cheap Chinese metal.
Es demaciado grandr e incomodo para afeitarse la cara, dificil de llegar a algunos puntos.

reviewTitle: This razor system is very rough on the skin.
reviewDescription: The main blade isn't bad but the "precision trimmer" blade is very rough on the skin.  I have cut myself with it.  I have shaved 3 times with this razor, so still evaluating.  At this point I regret buying this over my normal razor even if these are 1/4 of the price.

reviewTitle: By far the worst razor I've tried in a long time.  Painful and bad shave on a graying beard.
reviewDescription: I had used a Bic Sensitive single blade for as long as I can remember.  With more and more gray in my beard, I was only getting a handful of shaves before they were butter knife contenders and the shave took forever needing to go over my face a few times.I picked up a Harry's set from the local big box, these and a Schick Hydro Skin Comfort Sensitive set from here.  I've tried all 3 with both Edge and Harry's shave creams. I've tried all 3 for several months and after a final try with the Solimo today, I threw the remaining full refill pack and shaver in the trash after the photo.These are by far the worst of the 3.  With over the weekend growth the Solimo are so grabby and painful it almost brings tears to my eyes. Overnight grown is still quite painful and the shave is the same as a dull blade with the former Bic sensitives.  The edger is absolutely abhorrent and clearly designed by someone who has no mustache growth, nicking the inside of my nose several times when using the shaver side and pulls horribly when trying to clean up the sides. The swiveling head seems like it would be good, but functionally it's pretty worthless. I've tried new blades for each side of the face as well as tried to shave with 1 blade for a week to no avail, these are absolutely horrible.Schick hydro sensitive are decent.  They are a tad grabby on a Monday morning shave, but not bad on a single day growth.  There isn't an edger which isn't a deal breaker for me.  The shave is pretty good, about the same as I was achieving with the Bic Sensitive single blade but with much less effort.  The flex mechanism is ok, but not great under my chin.
