The blade life if pretty good, easily getting 1 week out of them but they peter out on trying for a second. They are still a little pricey comparatively but had I only tried these and the Solimo, the Schick are absolutely superior.Finally Harry's,  I was very hesitant to try another modern multi blade but the big box store had a great price so I gave it a shot.  On a Monday morning shave they are a little bit grabby, but less than the Schick.  T-Th they don't grab at all giving me a lighting fast and painless shave.  The shave is better than I've had since I barely had peach fuzz and had to shave in the Navy.  The edger is great leaving the sideburns even without any grabbing.  They Harry's blades give a great shave for the first week and still superior to the Schick or the former Bic until about the 9th day shaving but I push through to get 2 weeks out of them.TLDR:  These are awful on a graying beard.  Get Harrys.

I’m searching for a new razor since DSC discontinued their executive series, and I’d hoped this might be a hidden gem, but it’s not. Blades aren’t angled right, or spaced right, and the back blade is useless. I tried a few times, different lengths and thicknesses of hair (legs, arm pits, face) and it was equally ineffective on all of them. Left chunks of hair, clogged up super easy, didn’t get close/smooth…I threw it and the extra cartridge away. It’s slightly above the new DSC blades that cut absolutely nothing, but a throw away single blade bic gives a better shave than either of them. If you’re looking for a quality razor…this isn’t it. From worst to less-worse, I’d rank the new DSC, then this, a single blade bic, then Harry’s (husband loves, I do not). Next I’m going to try Mach3, Venus, and Gillette. I used Mach 3 for like 20 years, so that’s probably where I’ll end up since DSC destroyed their best razors. Skip this one- it’s useless.

reviewTitle: For painful knicks and cuts, subpar shaving, short lifespan.
reviewDescription: I tried this when I was living at a hotel for training for a month. I went through two of the packs of blades, PACKS, not heads. Ten heads.To be fair to most razors, I have a brain surgery scar that wraps from the side of my head down and around the back of my ear. It's just over a year old and has some uhm, topography to it, so I'm giving it more points for that difficulty than it deserves.This is a heavy, well built handle. It has a swivel of some sort, a ball like construction that seems to only serve to make it look like it's going to work around the contours of my head and face. It does not. It can't conform to anything at all and seems more rigid than even solid headed disposables.In fact, I think that's the point here. Someone, somewhere strapped five of the lowest quality blades to the least useful grooming/moisturizing head, put a ball like thing on it to look like it might have some swivel and passed off their schlock to Amazon, who, being in Seattle, Washington believe that beards are to be grown and never shaved.Short version, this is a multi bladed, swivel headed razor that chopped the crap out of my head and face while at the same time achieving a 50/50 ratio of shaving to epilation. Any kind of topographical changes in the shaving motion brings swift punishment, which is amazing considering how poorly the blades cut hair, they're absolutely up to the task of cutting skin. If for some reason you've grown tired of the luxury of skipping a day or two of shaving with other multibladed, swivel razors... or perhaps just LOVE shaving every single day, AND have a flat, single surface to shave AND have body/facial hair that is very fine, thin and yanks out as easily as it shaves off, then this is perfect for you.Otherwise, this thing feels and acts like a single bladed rigid plastic razor they'd give you while you're in observation at the psych ward. The only thing missing is a tired charge nurse watching your every move while you stand in the shower, awkward, naked, bleeding and clearly questioning whether or not you REALLY need to be worried about shaving right now.

I have been buying Harry's razors for a long time with very good results, however, I tried this new blade and boy what a mistake. The blades pull like you have used them for 10 shaves. I have to go over each area 3 or 4 times to get a clean shave. Good luck trying to shave up upper lip. The way to get a smooth shave there is to go against the grain and shave from the lip up to the nose. Good luck trying shave under your nostrils. Maybe it just me but I find attaching the razor to blade a pain. Going back to other Harry's blades if they still sell them. I'm 80 years and I know good blade from a bad one. This blade is bad!

I wanted to find shaving blades that were cheaper then the Gillette I've been buying for years.  I looked on Amazon and found these.  They're inexpensive, many many great reviews and a fantastic average rating.  That in addition to the fact that they're "Amazon's" internal brand, and so I thought I'd try them out.  I went to order the blades and found out they only fit their handle.  So being curious to see how well they work I ordered the handle which comes with two blades.  I tried, and tried, and tried to connect the blade with no luck.  Then mysteriously, with me doing the same thing over and over, it attached.  So I tried to do it over again thinking I may have gotten it and once again had the same problem.  They will attach after repeated attempts, but its in NO way intuitive.  The Walmart blades I last got are EFFORTLESS to attach to my Gillette handle.  All said, I'll use them, but with this experience I'll go back to Walmart and get theirs and would never order these again.

Not sure how there can be so many positive reviews. Maybe we got a lemon.These are Amazon brand, but they got ripped off by the contractor whom made these. They must've sent good ones to Amazon for their approval. While the end production quality is waaay off. These aren't even close.You know how there comes a point with blades where you can feel a tug/drag as you shave your face telling you that the blade's are nearing worn? That's how these were "new". ?? Unlike new blades of quality, where the blades just glide smoothly while cutting close too. Yeah, not these.I think Amazon needs to do a better QC evaluation of their contractor.

This isn't the worst SHAVING product I have ever purchased......it's the worst PRODUCT I have ever purchased.  Number one, it just does not cut wiskers well at all.  I have to go over each area three or four times pressing as hard as I can.  Number two, how in the world do you replace the blade?  It takes me about fifteen minutes before I somehow accidentally get the new blade attached.  Number three, the trimming blade just scratches your face.  Yes it's cheaper than the name brand razon........but I guess you get what you pay for.  Should have returned after the first use.

Let me start by saying that I have had good experiences with other Amazon Basic purchases.  This one however was no one of those.  Pros; at least given that the handle is reusable this product puts less plastic waste in landfills.Cons; this provides about the same level of shave as a cheap disposable razor.  Given that they put five blades in it the expectation is that it is somewhere in the range of comfort and efficiency as the Gillette fusion.  It is not even close on all accounts.  The final strike is that changing cartridges is a mission in itself.If you are trying to save money (and admittedly the Gillette products are pricy) just by a pack of Bic disposables  and comfort your face in knowing you saved money.

If you do not like a close shave, this is the razor for you!  I ran out of Gillette razors and was hoping this razor would be as good for half the price.  Unfortunately, they made the lubricant strips so thick that even after shaving up, down, and crisscrossed multiple times with plenty of pressure it looks and feels like I have a 5 o'clock shadow right after shaving.  I tried multiple razors for over a month to see if I could get better results, but I could not, so I finally ordered some more Gillette razors and can not wait to go back.  I like to try new products to see if I can find ones that save money with similar results, but this one failed miserably.  I hate to spend time shaving only to feel like I have not shaven.  I hate to shave the next day, and it looks like I have not shaven in 2 days.  Maybe the positive reviews for this product are from people moving up from one blade Bic disposables or electric razors, but if you have ever shaved with Gillette razors, you will be disappointed with this product.  My advice, save 20-30 dollars somewhere else, and stick with Gillette.  Don't throw 20 dollars in the trash like I did.  Good luck and happy shopping!

Maybe I’m missing something for others to rate this higher than a one star but it felt like a hacksaw on my face. Didn’t shave close and I had to actually look to see if there was a lubricating strip.  I rarely leave reviews but this razor, hands down the worst I’ve had in my 40 years of shaving.  I don’t know how else to describe it other than not smooth and it felt like it was ripping out each whisker one by one and not a close shave at all. Damn thing hurt!  (I used multiple razors too, not just one to be sure).  Will certainly not buy this again.
Looks like a Gillette but gets clogged much easierDoubt these will last as long as GillettePrice is a good but may not be as high qualityIt's a razor

reviewTitle: Overpriced - went up 30% in a year
reviewDescription: I'm not sure why they think that raising the price by 30% in one year is acceptable. So, although the quality was okay I'm dropping them.

When I found these I was hopeful. I've used the Dorco razors, happily, for years. They are a fraction of the price of the subscription services for same razor. I was hoping these would be on par with Dorco, since they are less expensive and Amazon brand is usually quite well made stuff.  I was not satisfied with these, however, and will be returning.They are a great value. They work, although I don't find them as nice as the Dorco brand. They don't seem to last as long so given you use more, it ends up costing the same. My big problem is the blades are very hard to attach and remove from the holder. They tend to come off the handle several times before you can get them to stay on and release. Maybe a design flaw, maybe I got a bad batch, I'm not sure. But, again, the Dorco brand just seems better made so I'm going back to them. If you can deal with a bit of frustration navigating the design of the razor then these are a good value. 3 stars.

Coming from the Gilette Fusion 5 Proglides I have used for over a decade, these don't really live up to the hype in my opinion. With a cross/against grain shave I get about as close a shave as I get with the Gilette with-grain. I'll throw these in my bug out bag and keep them handy in case I run out of Gilettes for whatever reason.The angle is different than the Fusions as well, so instead of a steady dragging motion you have more of a forceful scrape going on.They work in a pinch, but I would rather spend the money on a proven blade knowing I won't be wondering how much blood and razor burn I will endure later.A key thing to point out here is the trim blade on the back of the razor is duller than my exes future - I bled like a stuck piggy edging up my mustache. Won't make that mistake again.If you're coming from a basic blade like a disposable, these are an improvement IMHO. Like I said these will survive in my bug-out bag or when I'm out of town for work.
Tried these instead of Harry’s. Found they had drag but then I have a heavy beard.

reviewTitle: Good razor for the most part
reviewDescription: I like the shave that the five blades give. Don't know about the longevity, but the Gillette Fusion lasts me 6 months or more and I shave my head and face 3x/wk. The edging blade on the back, however, is much more pronounced so be careful. It has already nicked me twice.

Bought these as I'm not that fussy. This blade is reasonably sharp and works better than most disposal razors. But miss a day on weekend and suffer the torture of using this thing to cut stubble. When my blades run out I'll be moving on.

reviewTitle: It's ok, not at same level as the national brand
reviewDescription: The price is fair for a razor that gives you less shaves than the national brand, the trimmer is either positioned incorrectly or low quality because it actually cut me when I used it, and it feels rough compared to the brand that invented it.

reviewTitle: Works Decently Well, But Gets Dull Quickly
reviewDescription: I have used these as well as name-brand razor heads, and unfortunately these get dull much more quickly. The cost savings may make it worthwhile to just swap them more frequently, but I’m not a fan of the added waste.
Blades don't last but two shaves

reviewTitle: Doesn't work for me but appears that it does for a lot of guys
reviewDescription: I realize this product has a ton of four and five star reviews and I'm sure it's wonderful for most users. Without sounding like a negative Ned I have to admit that this doesn't work for me. I use a well known 3 blade razor which glides over my face. I was under the impression that 5 blades would be even better but for whatever reason, these blades feel like they are pulling the hairs rather than cutting them. I have to keep checking the mirror to see if I have cut myself. I even tried a couple of new blades that weren't needed just to see if there was a difference, but they were the same. This just isn't made for this old face.

These razors have potential and seem to be of decent quality, but there are simply too many blades.  They will not get into tight areas on your face because they’re too big - upper lip/under nose just can’t be done right.  Further, because there are so many blades, they’re less comfortable than quality brands with fewer blades because, after the 3rd blade makes its pass, the 4th and 5th blades irritate the skin.3 blades seems to be the magic number - fewer and you don’t get as good a shave with each pass, but more and you just start irritating the skin.Really wish they’d make these razors with fewer blades.
I was attracted to the price and 5 blade design, however after using Gillette & Bic, I must say these Amazon razors do not provide a close shave. I will be going back to Gillette and Bic.

Having used these for a while, I have to say I am pleased with the shave the razor gives. Clean, smooth, very few nicks. The trimmer blade on the back, however, is terrible. It feels like trimming with a rusty saw blade.It pulls and scratches. I would probably not buy again due to the trimmer blade.
Kinda not that sharp.

reviewTitle: Not as good as I'd hoped
reviewDescription: The blades keep popping off the handle with any kind of pressure at all, and they are most definitely not suitable for sensitive skin. There are better ones out there for the same cheap price.
I mistakenly though these would fit Gillette 5 blade shavers. It doesn't.
These blades are half as much as comparable Gillette blades. They just don't shave nearly as close. Like not even close. They also did not last as long as I would have liked.
so-so

reviewTitle: Stays sharp only for few shaves
reviewDescription: Flimsy
I have very thick hair, and this razor did not cut through my hair very well. Pulled my hair and gave me razor burn pretty bad.

Bought this product thinking it may be an alternative to Harry’s 5 blade razor and cartridges which don’t last but 4 or 5 shaves. I found the cartridge of this razor to perform no better that Harry’s and more difficult to mount to the handle.

I have a medium beard, semi-sensitive skin, and had been using Harrys for a couple of years.  Regret ordering less costly Amazon Basics.  First shave with Amazon, I felt pulling and chafing that perhaps came after four or five shaves with a Harry's blade, and usually prompted me to change the blade.  The "precision trimmer" (neither sharp nor precise) is its worst feature since it really does not serve its purpose.  I have used the first blade three times and each shave has been uncomfortable and left more stubble than a shave with an old Harry's blade.  Even at a bargain price, this is not a good deal.
The handle is too light to hold. There’s no gripping on handle, wants slip out your hand all the time. So many cuts. Ouch.

I've wanted to try the Amazon line of razors so I picked this one up to see how it compared to the 4 blade Dollar Shave Club razor.  The bottom line for me is there's no comparison.  The 5 blade Amazon does not give nearly the shave the Dollar Shave Club razor gives.  I still have hair and stubble in areas on my chin and upper lip area.  The blade itself it too wide for my face.  The blade gets clogged easily so I have to rinse it off after every swipe.I may try the three blade before I go back to dollar Shave.

I typically shave with Schick Hydro but decided to try these in an effort to save some $$$, as they were on for a good price during Prime Day.  But even brand new, they're not all that great.  Ok, they're better than cheapie disposables, but at their usual price there are way better options out there.  Sadly, they don't even seem to hold up as well as the Hydros, so it's not like there's value in their longevity.I'm using the ones I have because I'm cheap & they work ok for a while.  But I won't be ordering more when they're gone.

I wasn’t very impressed with these razors. I shave my face and my head. They worked well for one shave, after that, the trimmer blade began to clog and the lubrication strips disappear. If you plan on shaving once, for a trip or on vacation, then they would be ok. If you’re looking for a daily shaver or razors with durability, I do not recommend these.

reviewTitle: Not as great as I thought
reviewDescription: Something about the blades is off to me. I don’t know if it becomes blunt more easily or if it’s not as sharp as compared to name brand but I don’t get a good shave on my face and I have facial hair that is more dense if you will. Works great for body hair but for facial hair I went back to name brand.

So I ordered these razors being the cheap individual I am. Looking for a deal and not wanting to pay the amount wanted for other razors. I am bald so I shave my head twice a week. The razors will last maybe through those 2 shaves if your lucky. Now I haven't cut my head with a razor in 10 years but ... you guessed it. Slice and I am bleeding like a stick pig.So the razors being the quality of the razors they give out for free at the holiday in when you forget your own are kind of like shaving with a butter knife taken across a grinder after a shave.OK, so you get what you pay for, but wait there's more! About the 3rd time you change the cartridge the handle will not grab the cartridge without manipulating the little hooks with your fingers. Then the plastic that holds the cartridge won't let go and you crack the deal. Razor cartridge's everywhere.Just pony up and buy some name brand quality razors.

reviewTitle: Not even close to a Dollar Shave razor
reviewDescription: Didn't like the weight and took several strokes to get a close shave. You get what you pay for.

Previously I've only ever used Gillette Mach series but they're so expensive I thought I'd give this a try. Is it cheaper? Absolutely. Will it shave? Sure. But it is also noticably rougher on my skin, and doesn't cut down as low. I can feel it catching and pulling on hairs. I lasted a few months before going back to the latest mach fusion whatever. If you want to save some bucks and have tougher skin, go for this. If you like a close shave that's more gentle on this skin, go for the more expensive brands.
Very disappointed, I get one decent shave and 1 marginal one and have to change blades.  The Gillete blades are much better.

reviewTitle: Feels like a Bic throw away razor
reviewDescription: If you did not shave for a couple of days you will not get a smooth shave . Schlick is a better razor

These are nice for the price, though they can struggle on the neck and underside of the chin. I end up having to go back over these areas with the one-blade grooming edge. That's not right. It shouldn't be necessary to use a small grooming blade to do 1/3 of your shave.I'm not returning it or anything, but I'm looking elsewhere next time. Having to go over skin repeatedly with 5 blades gives me more razor burn than I'm used to.

I bought these as a cheaper alternative to dollarshave club I also get off of amazon I generally love amazon brand products but these were not worth it cut up my boyfriend face and when I tried it on my leg I saw that he was right left shaving bumps everywhere and had razor burn. Felt like those cheap bissell razors.I gave it 2 cuz the razor handle seemed decent quality but I had to throw these razor heads away hate wasting money.

I have used Gillette for the past 15 years, but due to the higher prices I purchased these to try out.  As soon as you open the package the razor body feels cheaper. compared to the PROGLIDE.  The build quality is definitely low.  The main 4 blades are ok, but the single 5th blade is horrendous.  I have used Proglide up to the point of where it begins to irritate my skin and that is over a month of use.  These took about a week.  I'm planning of returning these and going back to Proglide.

reviewTitle: Not a great alternative, just a cheap one
reviewDescription: I hate paying a lot for razors and this product had gotten fairly decent reviews.  I have not been impressed.  I have historically  used Gillette blades, but I also periodically will use Schick blades.  Below are my observations with the Amazon blades compared to the others:*  The blades are not as sharp as the others I mentioned.  They just don't cut as well.*  The gap between the first blade and the top of the razor is too large.  It makes it challenging to trim below your nose.  I kept leaving hair right below my nose because you have to push your nose up to reach.*  Part of the reason the gap is so large is because it has the extra lubricant on the blade.  It was nice, but actually a little excessive.  When I would get in the shower to shave the lubricant would be "foaming" off that top part.  Make it smaller and you won't need so much lubricant.*  The blades are hard to get on the handle.  The other brands are just an easy click.  I have to work hard to get the handle on these blades.I would not recommend these blades unless you are just looking to save money.

I don't usually leave reviews for something with so many already but, this product is rated too high. If you shave everyday this blade works fine. However, shaving with three days of stubble is very painful.

I used these razors for about a year. They were hard to use around my lip / nose area always seemed to nick myself. The other areas of my face the razor work fine. One of my biggest complaints was it was extremely hard to get the replacement blades out of the holder when changing and trying to line of the handle when replacing  blades was extremely hard.

Multi-blade razors are pricey - this Amazon one is too because of its poor quality causing a shorter useful life span.  So better to buy another pricey brand that at least doesn't feel so rough on your skin and has an actual trimmer feature for under your nose.  These razors caused bleeding for me at least 50% of the time.

reviewTitle: Good price but rough on skin
reviewDescription: The blades do not feel very sharp. Lots of pulling causes a very uncomfortable shave

I thought these razors were a great value, and I like the way the handle feels, but I’m not using these any more because they’re giving me bad razor burn. I switched to a more moisturizing shave gel and they are still irritating my skin. I’ve only used 2 of the razors, the rest are going in the trash. Bummer and a waste of money.
Straight trash

reviewTitle: Not as smooth as I thought
reviewDescription: Which is not to say that these might work for some people but not me. But then again I’ve been using Gillette for years so maybe I’m just used to them

The blades work fine for shaving albeit a little rough.  The precision trimmer is like torture though.  You can feel each hair being ripped out of your face.  I've never used something so painful before.  You may as well use pliers to rip them out.  Completely useless.  I try the trimmer on each razor thinking maybe the last one was a fluke but they are all the same.

reviewTitle: I got so many cuts.  The worst blades.  Nothing like any of the good ones.  Very dissappointed!
reviewDescription: I dislike them.  I had many cuts from these blades and I will never buy them again.  Wish I could get my money back!

reviewTitle: This thing is sharp...but it cuts more than just hair
reviewDescription: I'll keep it short and simple; I don't recommend these blades.  I decided to try them out because generally speaking, all the Amazon branded products I've tried have been on point.  This one however, is gonna have to take the "L".  The price is amazing (only reason I gave a 2-star); nowadays, razor blades can get pricey...but that's really as far as it goes.  Not really sure how they're manufactured, but these blades end up cutting me everywhere.  Tried shaving my legs with it once and ended up walking out of the shower with blood patches all over.  Same story with other areas.  Unfortunately, I will not be buying these again.

reviewTitle: Main blades ok but trimmer blade terrible!
reviewDescription: My first impression is the main blade (five blades) surface  is ok and I could live with it... took a bit more effort than the high price blades but for the price that could be acceptable.  However when I went to use the single trim blade, it was horrible, till cuts, scrapes, and bleeding nicks under my nose area forced me to give up on it.  I cannot return these, so I will give them to my brother who uses them, (He recommended them) but evidently does not use the single trim blade. If you don't need that trim blade, these are a suitable replacemnt for the high price blades.

The good and not so good: shaves well; about as well as a traditional 2 or 3 blade disposable razor but, because of its size, not as maneuverable as the smaller razor.The bad:1. tricky to attach blade to handle.2. weak link: the handle is plastic and fragile.  Mine was accidentally dropped: the small plastic 'ball' where the blade attaches broke off and cannot be re-attached.  The result: a box full of blades that can't be used unless one  purchases  another handle and set of blades:  too expensive, too fragile, not worth the investment.

reviewTitle: Cheap, usable, but blades dull quickly
reviewDescription: I've got a pretty strong beard that grows in quickly (noticeable the day after), so I shave every few days. I can get two good shaves out of one razor before it's too dull. On the second shave, there's already noticeable dulling, but still workable.
Las mejores navajas de afeitar que he usado en mi vida, además son bien económicas

*Please note, I posted the exact same review for the women's razors*I've been a reluctant Gillette Venus (GV) user for 15 years. I say reluctant because, let's face it, $13 is the cheapest you pay for 4 cartridges?! Ouch!! But every time I tried something cheaper I was let down, so, reluctantly, I stuck with GV. I'm happy to report I'm officially a convert!!My husband is a firefighter and he likes his head shaved down to practically below the pores. It's common to use 2-3 cartridges for his head alone. I'm what you'd call a lazy shaver - I procrastinate so long that by the time I actually do shave, you could fashion together a faux taxidermied hamster with all the hair I shave off my body. Usually one cartridge will suffice for my shaving, but needless to say that one cartridge doesn't last much longer than 2 sessions. So between my husband and I, we go through a 4 pack of cartridges every couple weeks, about $26/month; that turns into over $300 a YEAR!!! 😳I've now used both the men's Solimo razor and the women's twice, one on each leg and armpit, as well as the women's on my...ahem...Nether Regions. Both times have given me super smooth shaves, zero cuts, no razor burn or irritation, and I haven't missed any spots. I've posted pictures with the Venus in the middle to compare sizes, shapes and looks, and one shows how the cartridges attach (as stated in the details, the Solimo cartridges do not attach to the Venus handles). I'll list my pros and cons for both, as follows.Women's pros:- love the handle, it's hard to lose your grip on it- LOTS of vitamin E moisturizing lubricant, versus the single strip GV has- kind to the *lady parts* with no irritation- super smooth shave- easy to replace cartridges- comes with a suction cup shower hangerWomen's cons:- the vitamin E gets super slippery at first use; after that it calms down- cartridge head is significantly larger than the GV I've been using, it will take some getting used toMen's pros:- solid handle, even feels heavy- nice smooth, clean shave- pivoting head as shown in pictures- sleek metallic look- also easy to replace cartridgesMen's cons:- handle is heavier toward the cartridge, almost makes it awkward to use- not as much lubricationAll in all I'm so pleased with both of these razors, and am looking forward to paying an entire third of what I've been paying for Gillette Venus razors. Thank you Solimo!!!
The blades are amazing

I seldom leave good reviews. I should but I mostly just complain about products that don’t live up to expectations. This razor changed my ways….for now. So I’d been loyal to a razor with a model whose name that reminded me of my brothers Mach1 mustang. I thought that was as good of a shave that I could expect. I finally decided to try another razor to see if I was missing out on something. I tried a three letter razor that rhymes with tick and I think I’d prefer a tick over that razors crazy whisker pulling (not cutting) action.This razor works very well. It has a nice heavy feel to it and the cutters sliced through my 3 day old stubble like it was made of cooked spaghetti. Really happy with this purchase. Definitely recommend.

reviewTitle: wow finally i have found an affordable set of razors that work on my skin type
reviewDescription: I have been looking for an affordable set of disposable razors with the changeable ends for many years now. I have a super odd kind of skin that is very hard to shave. I have tried straight razors to safety razors in the metal thing that screws into a base. I have tried super expensive kinds that only end up being worse than the cheap variations. While i do find certain razors that work, they always end up being a rip off. For example, i can buy a super expensive kind that has those disposable ends that are like half a hundred dollars for a weeks supply but the longevity of the blades never last. They may give a great initial first or second shave but end up dulling out just like any other one.Finally i can rest easy knowing i have found something that works. Amazons own brand Solimo has delivers the goods again for me with a razors set that not only can handle my skin type but comes in a hooked up pack. I forget exactly how many are in there but it think it is close to thirty. Regardless of the exact count it has bypassed anything out there in relation to value and quality.The main razor that accept the disposable ends is made sturdy and can handle being dropped on the ground and exposed to water constantly.I would of been happy with two or three blades but you get five. This is something to celebrate. I am so happy i will not be burning a hole in my pocket anymore and will stock up on this multi pack offer.In conclusion i am super happy with this set and give it five stars easily.

I happened to need my fusion 5 refills & I saw this product from Amazon. I took a chance & it's better than the fusion 5 from gilette.  You'll get a better razor & save up to 75% over the fancy name brands. This is the best Amazon brand product I have ever used.

reviewTitle: Been a Gillette man for 30+ years...
reviewDescription: With the price of everything going up and up and getting burned recently with some knockoff fusion blades. I read the reviews and decided to try these. At first i was like wtf is this...but i didn't nick nor burn my face while shaving. The other crazy part is that these cut just as good as the real Gillette blades. While the setup is different there is a little learning curve but after the second shave i was taking the same amount of time shaving as i did with the gillette blades.I'm happy with this purchase. Ohh blade life is pretty much the same too and i have thick hair.
Used a Mach 3 for years. Blades are too expensive. This Amazon brand razor is definitely an upgraded experience and the cheaper option.
Wve bought so many different brands, Harry's, Gillette, dollar shave club and these are the best . And you get so many for the price. We will keep buying

reviewTitle: Grooming Precision: Amazon Basics 5-Blade Razor Set for Effortless Shaving
reviewDescription: Recently switched to the Amazon Basics 5-Blade MotionSphere Razor, and it's a grooming game-changer. The dual lubrication ensures a smooth glide, and the precision trimmer is a handy addition. With 16 cartridges included, it's a fantastic value. The sleek black design and compatibility with Amazon Basics razor handles make it a reliable and affordable choice for men's grooming.

The pivoting and rotating head has two week of a spring to maintain any pressure on your face. This is causes you to attempt to hold this in an awkward angle while shaving. Basically, it’s a gimmick.  I do not recommend this product.
I did not like it, it feels so rough on my face, don’t like it at all

After using the razors for nearly 6 months, I can say that the quality is subpar. Have had multiple incidents of cuts because the razor blades would become blunt halfway, and required significant pressure to work at all, causing more cuts and rashes.

reviewTitle: Worst ever only good for couple shaves.
reviewDescription: Liked the price. But they only last 1 or 2 shaves and there dull and start pulling. Been shaving 48 years and these are the worst. Would send back put already used 2 of them thinking maybe it was just the one loaded in handle. Nope on 3rd cartridge and still worn out by 3rd shave. Kinda makes the price not so good. When I have cheap store brands last a month or longer.

These cartridges were so bad I thought my wife used them to shave her legs……..trimmer angle seems designed to slice cold cuts……tried several to see if some were just faulty…..too much of a pain to return them. - straight into the trash bin

reviewTitle: Left a rash and blade kept falling off.
reviewDescription: I really wanted to love this razor. But unfortunately it didn't work for my sensitive skin. I was hoping to get away from my Schick hydro razor because these are so much cheaper. But, I used it 3 times, (I used it with my shave cream that I always use when I used my schick hydro) and ended up with a rash in my arm pits all three times. So I've stopped using it and went back to my Schick hydro with no issues. I always shave when I shower so I know that wasn't the issue. Also the way it's designed if I let my finger get to close to where the blade locks on I would hit the button, and the blade would pop off in the middle of shaving. I'm very disappointed. I bought 2 of them but unfortunately missed my window to return the one I never opened. I don't recommend!

reviewTitle: You every step on a slug barefoot?
reviewDescription: The slime strip on this razor is like stepping on a slug barefoot and trying to rinse off the resulting thick goo.  The goo is SO THICK and SO ABUNDANT that it prevents the blades from ever touching your hairs.  It's not too bad for the first swipe or two, but then it turns into a gross mess with streamers of thick slime stretching from the blade to your skin.  The blades sort of slide across the surface of the slime and you end up missing hairs.  When you decide to rinse off the slime to try to get at all the missed patchwork of hairs, it's exactly like trying to scrub off slug slime, it takes forever and no matter how much water you use the slippery stuff doesn't fully wash off.If you buy these razors, do yourself a favor and pry off the slime strips.Please fire the slime strip guy.

Not sure what all the rave reviews are about.  My husband has used Gillette ProGlide for many years but we were looking for a cheaper alternative.  After using this razor for the first time, my husband's face looked like he'd been in a fight with a cat.  To add insult to injury (literally!), it is ridiculously difficult to load a new cartridge onto the razor.  We've given up.
Only bad razor I’ve ever purchased. All blades felt dull and hurt to shave with.
I'm only giving a one star because that's the lowest it will allow, a negative 5 is more appropriate on these razors. You end up shaving 4 times with one blade and still not a close shave.
The blades give a smooth irritation free shave.
This razor is a great price. The blade does wear quick though that’s why I gave a 4 star review.

You get what you pay for. I’ve been a Gillette Mach 3 guy for almost 30 years. They aren’t cheap but they are amazing. Tried this razor out. Ehhh it’s alright. I think it compares to the Quattro pro. Pros- good razor. Great price.Cons- not that great at shaving the neck area, had to pass over it numerous times and making me worried about razor burn. Also you have to press down pretty hard with this razor to get it to shave closely. Never had that problem with the Mach 3.All in all- you get what u pay for. Still a decent razor for the price. When I use up all the razors I’ll probably go back to Gillette.
These 5-blade razors are a good value overall compared to the name brand products, however blades seem to dull after only a few uses. Prior versions of these blades would not dull as quickly.

I was a Gillette fan for years, but wanted to move on, as cost and other issues sent me away.  Read all of the blogs and comments on better shaving systems and razors, and you have to find your comfort and value. Tried the Amazon razor system, and for the price, it does a great job.  I use Schick and Amazon, switching back and forth as both offer a better deal and a good shave.  I will continue to purchase these blades,  as I mentioned, it's a great value.
I am satisfied with this razor and blade. After using a prominent brand for several years I decided to give this Amazon razor a try. I am pleased thus far and recommend it. The price is good.
Wanted to see if these were comparable to dollarshave club, they are lesser quality but still not bad

reviewTitle: Only one shaver cap, don't lose it
reviewDescription: Even though the shaver comes with several shave replacements, you only have one cap. So don't throw it away. They shave really good and it's the closest shave I've ever had, which is great. But the one cap for your shaver to protect the blade and you is really irritating. I would recommend getting a case for your shaver or make sure to never lose it.

A few big issues for me when I buy razor’s1. Life span ( these will give you quite a few shaves)2. Wash out( These razors actually wash out better the name brands)3 ease of replacement ( The only thing that could be improved it putting on the new blades, not as easy as higher price models)Over all these are great razors for what you pay, I’ve used other cheap models with big promises “dollar shave””Harry’s “ and have not purchased them since however I will be buying these again when it’s time.

I got these a while back, I like them.  However, getting the handle  to accept the blade is a challenge.  It is not as simple as the diagrams show.  Tonight it took me 25 minutes to get the right angle, and that is why I am writing this.  Some guys can get this on the first try, for some reason I just could not get  it.  Once  on, the head is very flexible and shaves very well.  Just don't get too aggravated getting the blade in.

reviewTitle: For a shave as close as a blade, this ain't it.
reviewDescription: I almost never return things. These, I did. I read lots of reviews, glowing prose that obviously took some time so they must be great, right? The shave was disappointing. I understand that the price for Gillette blades is astronomical. I was hoping for something close for a lot less money. I shave my face and head every day.I'd give these blades 7/10 for sharpness and 6/10 for closeness. Sadly disappointing. I find the Dorco 5 and 6 blade versions are much better for only a little more.  These blades took me 3 passes for a poor shave that wasn't close.

The 5 blades are good but I'm not sure what the precision trimmer is, if like a Gillette cartridge with single blade on top then not good if the 5 blades are supposed to be the precision then not good and not precise. if precision single blade on top it isn't obvious like Gillette there is something sharp on top but pulls hair instead of cutting. Overall I wouldn't buy these again.

While the price of the razor may be good, the precision trimmer (for under nose, etc.) is not at all smooth. In fact, it is rough and leaves raw skin. The Gillette precision trimmer is significantly better.If the trimmer is not important to you, then the Amazon razor is the way to go.If the trimmer is important, then pay a little extra, and get a better product.

reviewTitle: the razors are fine but the packaging makes it really challenging
reviewDescription: I don't see a lot of people mentioning this, am I the only one to experience it ?  and is there something wrong with me ?The idea of inserting the razor handle into the individual cartridges and yanking out each is good in theory, but the cartridges are jammed so tightly into the container that I always fear I'll break the handle and / or the cartridges.  I finally resorted to using kitchen scissors to try + cut open the plastic container to access the cartridges more easily, but pieces of the plastic went flying all over and some pieces were quite sharp + could easily hurt a family member or myself .... if there is a secret to pulling these cartridges out, please share your secret ... maybe I just got a 'dud' package but I vaguely remember struggling with this same thing last time I purchased these, although I am not certain.so, .... razors = 4 stars .... packaging = 2 stars .... average = 3 stars
Nice handle, but blades are not sharp enough.

reviewTitle: Didn't live up to the real thing...Gillette
reviewDescription: My husband tried these and said they pulled a lot and were not even close to the first shave he got with his Gillette. He said when this starts to happen with his Gillette, it's time to throw away and get a new one!
AVerage quality, not as good as Gilet
It has barely any lubricant and don't stay sharp but maybe 2 shaves

This little seems ok, the back trimmer is just about worthless. I cant figure out what angle it wants to be at. or that blade is just dull maybe.  If feels like its trying to pull the hair.  The front normal blade are standard, they do what they are suppose to do, and with easy cleanout.  I still get random nicks, much more than the gillette gave me. I also shave 6-7 days a week, pretty thick and fast growing facial hair, these blades are lasting a month, about the same as the gillette

reviewTitle: I wanted these to be great
reviewDescription: I bought these to replace my Schick 5 blades. I shaved half my head with this brand new razor, and the other half with an already twice used Schick 5 and the old razor still worked better. Even used, S5 was still sharper than the brand new Amazon razor. Great price, though.

I used this razor for months and was constantly wondering why my skin always itched, some facial hair was missed when shaving, and razor bumps were everywhere on my face. I finally returned to Schick razor blades and my skin returned to normal. Terrible quality product — stick to name brands!

I did not like the design of the razor head because it missed a lot of spots on my face and neck. I spent 30 minutes shaving my face and neck with this razor. The precision blade is rough and hurt sensitive places on my face. I am upset I bought this 16 pack because I thought it was an amazing price. Now I know why it was so cheap. This one sucks compared to Bic Flex 5. I just finished shaving my face and neck and I am just so frustrated with the experience of this razor. Poorly made.

reviewTitle: The neck broke off after one use before finishing my head
reviewDescription: The neck broke off after one use leaving the back of my head unfinished. Now I have a bunch of new blades but I’m unable to use them because they do not attach to any other necks. The handle felt very strong and durable so it’s a shocker that the neck broke so fast.

For shaving of course  what would you use a razor for,That was really a stupid question.The blades are really dull and left my face all red, I don't recommend this razor for anyone who has sensitive skin.Have used this razor for half dozen times and the blades are the worst I have ever shaved with and I am 80 years old, they don't shave the hairs of it pulls them out.If I could give it a-10 rating I would.

I now know why razors are so expensive. I tried Amazon Basic to save some money. This felt like I was shaving with old nails. I love Amazon basics stuff but not for these. Threw it out and spending the money on the good ones.

used 3 times and I am throwing it away, each time it felt like shaving with a block sander, I will go back to my old 2 blade Gillette skin guard razor, closer shave and no irritation for me compared to the this one
Bought this because the reviews seemed good and I was looking for a way to cut costs.  The old say " you pay for what you get ". Was not even close to the quality of the major brands. Returned it !!

reviewTitle: The blades wanted to skip over my skin instead of shaving the day old stubble
reviewDescription: The blades seemed to be dull and would not cut.  I shave my face and head daily.  These blades would not cut more than 1 side of my face before losing the edge and starting to skip over my skin.
Cheaply made.  The pitch of the blades greatly increased the risk of cutting yourself and razor burn.  Not as sharp as my brand name that had already been used three times.  Will be returning.

This razor is awful compared to that of Harry’s. I was looking to get away from Harry’s and gave this a shot but it was terrible. The amount of clogging is just brutal. You have to rinse it after practically every swipe and it leaves hair behind. Not a fan AT ALL. The trimmer blade tugs at my hair too, I stopped halfway through and went back to my old razor.

reviewTitle: Why is the protective cap for this razor so delicate? Amazon, please make this product better!
reviewDescription: I have had 2 of the caps for this razor break now. A tab on the end piece of the cap (protective cover) breaks, and now the cap won't stay on the razor. This seems very dangerous to have this way. Amazon, can you please make this cap with a tougher plastic that won't break so easily? I am not mishandling the product, and it has not been dropped in either incident. I never have had this problem with Gillette or other brands, only with the Amazon Basics product. To make things more frustrating, I called Amazon and they will not replace the product because it has been over 30 days. Amazon, please improve your product! Please send me a cap that doesn't break, or at least send me a new cap - this time I will try to reinforce it with glue before I use it! (Which of course is something that I should NOT have to do, if you would just make your product worthy! As it stands, this is a dangerous piece of junk!)

reviewTitle: Unfortunatly the worst razor Ive ever used..
reviewDescription: Now before people start assuming Im some shaving elitist, Im not. I use the same canned shaving cream/gel Ive used for years through numerous different brand razors, gillete fusion/ dorco / dollar shave club/ and even disposable cheap 3 and 2 blade ones. I was just previously on the dorco 4-blade razor but because it was missing the trimmer blade which is on the gilletes for under the nose, I was looking for a cost efficient alternative. I gave this a shot because it had a trimmer , 5 blades, and was extremely economical with a heavy duty handle and 16 blades for just around $20 in a bundle.Ill just get right into it. I just had my first shave with this at the usual interval and I was extremely disappointed. Im not someone who is a diehard perfectionist in this aspect but even the cheap disposable razors Ive used have been more efficient. This blade clogged really quickly even though it advertises "anti clog" features, I presume theyre talking about having spacing so water can go through it. I had just about everything stick there besides water and had to carefully declog it using my nail and hope I didnt cut myself in the process. The lubricating strip is ridiculously lubricating to the point it leaves a gel like layer that I had to wash off my face after. I could see it sticking to my face and pulling when I moved the blade away (think of when you touch glue how it tries to hang from your finger and the surface). Then for the 3rd strike, the trimmer blade is constructed and implement in the worst form possible that I was unable to get the edge of under my nose area. While attempting to use the trimmer there you get a lovely layer of gel from the strip which is too close to the trimmer blade so your basically smudging the lubricating substance on your nose constantly. Finally at the end I actually ended up with razor burn which was a first. I have not had razorburn for at least 15 years and was ultimately regretting my purchase.These are cheap and economical but I cant see these lasting long considering how bad its clogging with skin/hair/lubricating strip gel.

I have been a Gillette Pro Glide Power user for years, but figured I would try this product as I have had good experiences with Amazon Basics.However, these razors are terrible. They don't cut well (poor shave) and I definitely bled more with these. I even tried a few different blades just in case I had a bad one (same poor result). I have used better throw away razors.Don't waste your time with these razors.

Not quite sure how this razor got so many positive reviews. It cuts like a month old disposable razor that's been left in salt water. The trimming blade pills the hairs out, which I'm pretty sure is not the desired effect.I would rather use a prison shank sharpened on concrete than this death machine.On a positive note, I now know what to get my mother-in-law for her birthday!

These are horrible! I bought the two pack, and both blades were dull. I couldn't even finish a shave. One of the reasons I tried these is because of the 5 star reviews. I have no idea how somebody could give this product a 5 star review. Just horrible. Before writing this review, I went and read the 1 star reviews, and they were all saying the same thing.

reviewTitle: Spend a few more dollars to get something better
reviewDescription: Nothing about this has been a good experience. I have already put replacement cartridges for my old razor in my cart to purchase when I finish writing this review. It looks ok, but it is clunky, painful to use, and the shave is not good. I can’t return the product apparently so I’ll just call this a learning experience. First bad experience with an Amazon basics product.

I bought this with modest expectations. I was hoping that, for the price, it would be half as good as the Gillette Fusion I've been using since its introduction. Fusion had replaced the Mach5, which was good, though not as good as the Fusion.I had a Fusion razor/cartridge I'd already used for three shaves in the shower caddy, as I often can get a good fourth from it. I was excited to try this Solimo razor and cartridge, thinking I'd save some money on cartridges going forward. On its first use, it pulled like the blades were dull. I gave it a chance, lathered again, and it did a slightly better job. But when I'd done half my face, I became impatient, used the old Fusion and got a superior shave.I repeated this, again with reasonable expectations. I didn't expect it to be as good as the Fusion--though I hoped for that, and my mind was open to it. Again, I used that old Fusion razor to finish the job (the Fusion now had been used for four shaves before this one). It was stunning to me that this was again the result. I changed the Solimo cartridge (a second new one), repeated this process again. And again, the Fusion, on shave number five, did a better job.It would have been great, but I won't order again. I don't have a particularly coarse beard, either, so I can't blame anything but the quality and sharpness of the blades. I'd hoped for "half as good" and wound up with a fraction of that. Money wasted.

reviewTitle: Pretty good razor and blades for the price
reviewDescription: What matters in buying a razor - 1) Quality of the shave.  I haven't found a razor better than Gillette that give a close, smooth shave.  These Amazon Basic blades do a pretty good job, but I suspect that those who have a burly beard (I don't) will be disappointed in their shave.  2) Price. Gillette charges an excessive price for their blades. Not worth the cost for me.  These are very reasonably priced. 3) How long the blades stay sharp.  So far I've found these to be rather inconsistent in how long they last. But on a whole have lasted about as long as I would expect from a blade.  4) Mechanism for mounting the blades on the razor.  The blades easily mount on the Amazon Basic razor handle.  I had another off-brand razor that I tried and within a few months the mounting mechanism would break down and I'd have to buy a new razor handle.  Hopefully this one holds up.  So far, no problems.
Depending on how often you shave. Everyday shaver like me, it doesn't really close shave. But overall it's good for the price

I saw all the good star ratings and thought I would try this as a replacement to my Gillette Fusion5 razor that had broken.  This razor will get the job of a general shave done.  If you want a great, 100% smooth shave, prepare to spend time and effort to get there.  What angle the razor is held, what angle the razor is in contact with the skin (how to get at that stubble just under my nose was tough to do!), and at what speed the razor is used take time and are still variable after multiple shaves with this system.Blades from this package seemed to dull quickly (2-3 shaves).  The system for switching out razors via the clip system isn't intuitive and I found myself struggling to "lock on" so I could start a shave with a new blade.Gillette razors (Fusion 5) have a better weighted/balanced handle, hold a sharp edge longer, blade changes are seamless and intuitive, and produce a clean shave whether you're in a hurry or are taking your time.  There is a price difference between Solimo and Gillette - with good reason.  If you are looking to save some dollars and have the time and patience, the Solimo system might be a good fit.

reviewTitle: Not the best money can buy, but a lot of value for the money!
reviewDescription: Okay, I’ll be the first to admit it, I am old school when it comes to razors.  I learned to shave with a Twin Trac.  I hated shaving and grew a lot of facial hair over the years.  I tried a lot of different electric razors, then went back to the wet shave twin blades several years ago. I can get a decently comfortable and close shave with a twin blade provided I don’t  get in a hurry and keep a steady technique and do everything right.  I was pretty happy with the twin blade.  I’d tried the 3, 4, and 5 blade razors and thought they gave a nice shave but was unwilling to pay the price for the replacement cartridges.  Several months ago, I bought a 5 blade Bic Us razor handle with 2 cartridges for a promotional price.  I was very impressed with the ease of use and quality of shave with the razor.  The cartridges lasted a long time and did not clog up or dull.  I used one cartridge shaving every day for over 2 months.  However, when I went to buy replacement cartridges, they were $10 for 4.  Not terribly unreasonable for quality 5 blade razor cartridges but not dirt cheap either.  I had made up my mind to buy some when I saw this Amazon private label razor handle with 16 cartridges for only a couple dollars more than the 4 cartridge pack for the Bic.  The cartridges are almost identical -  5 blade, lubrication, and top trimmer blade.  The Amazon-branded Solum is about 1/4 of the price.  Unfortunately the cartridges only work with this particular brand of razor handle.  I like the Bic a little better because the handle is heavier and has a better grip.  It seems like it shaves a little better, too.  Not 4 times better, though.  I’m very happy with the Solimo.  The 16 cartridges will easily last me a year and a half to two years.  I don’t know how it compares to the Harry’s or Dollar Shave Club razors.  It compares favorably with the Shick Hydro 5 and the Bic Us.  I feel that it is not quite as good as the premium brands but is ver close.  I haven’t seen anything of comparable quality even close to this price point.  If you are needing a quality wet shave razor and are strapped for cash or just looking for a bargain. I would recommend you give the Solimo handle and cartridge set a try.  You should not be disappointed unless you are a serious shaving snob.

reviewTitle: Better than gillette in quality and cost
reviewDescription: I needed to shave for an appointment so I purchased this due to the price point.I have been a gillette man my entire life.  Any other brand of razor I have used always felt scratchy and the blade sharpness didn't last past 3 uses, but I figured this was a one time thing.I forgot to order shaving cream since I haven't really shaved in well over a year.  I used just bar soap and water.  This was one of the smoothest shaves I have had.  Normally, I reshave certain areas multiple times against the grain to achieve the best result.  With this razor, I only went once against the grain and didn't need to repeat. My skin wasn't irritated afterwards.The trimming razor is a little scratchy on the neck area, but to be fair it was working with 2 inch old man thick white hairs.The main body feels sturdy, easy to grip, and has a positive weighty feel.I will keep shaving and edit later with a durability update.
