I ordered these not expecting much. These are good for max 2 shaves each but at a cost point that I use a new blade each shave and still save a ton. I'd recommend.

reviewTitle: If you are looking to compare this to Gillete, read on
reviewDescription: I was looking for new razor and as usual i was going to get another Gillete. When i saw this in this listing, i wanted to give it a try since i have tried other Amazon basic products and some of them were great.I have used this 5 times so far, so cant speak to longevity yet but overall it feel pretty smooth. Compared to Gillete ProGlide, this has 5 blades, easy to turn with flex ball, lube strip at the top etc. Cost wise it is cheaper than Gillete for sure. One bad design is the top / back blade, it is too sharp compared to any other shaving blades i have used Gillete throw aways, Fusion, Costco brand , ProGlide etc. It does slow me down to shave the beard just below the nose but overall its great product. Hope Amazon reads this and fixes the product design haha.

reviewTitle: Let's cut to the chase...get it?
reviewDescription: Alright: here is the skinny on this razor and blades. If you were to compare them to blades of greater value, these are only going to be decent. Man I miss my Gillette blades. BUT I was sick of paying so much money for Gillette...almost triple the cost of these blades.Decent cut, holds a edge for far longer than I expected for this price. That alone convinced me to stay with these cheaper blades. My only major beef is the beard trimmer. It sucks. It feels like a jagged piece of glass scraping and barely cuts. I've given up using it and just make do with the regular front cutting side.I considered giving this three stars but when I look at the value and price it's not fair comparing to the more expensive brands (which I'll never go back to). A solid 4 stars.

If I were to review any kind of razor for men, I'm holding it up against the pro shield 4 from Gillette. That razor doesn't even feel like shaving. It's that good.Solimo then. What did I love about it. The packaging. You know that kind of fully wrapped packaging where you have to cut through it with a knife, or scissors? None of that here. Just tear the paper back off. Thank You!The handle. There's a nice thickness comparable to Gillette but with extra grip near the top of the razor, at the side of the ball thingy. I don't know who holds it that high up, but it is a nice grip. Someone might use that.Then there's the bit that matters. The razor. 5 blades, dual strip. Close comfortable shave and it doesn't feel like shaving while the blade glides across your skin. Win! As close to being like Gillette as anyone can be.The slight, ever so slight down side. You know that extra blade at the top? The one you can use for trimming. Well, it doesn't have that. I don't know if you will miss it, but depending on the contours of your face, there might be some hard to get at areas. Such as right under your nose. There's a trade off here because LOOK HOW CHEAP THESE BLADES ARE!!!That's my first impression. I'm going to have to use it a while longer. The tragic downfall of Gillette is those blades don't last long at all for how much we pay. Will update this review when it starts to get scratchy.Three weeks is the answer then. That is how long it took for this to get scratchy, where I want to change the blade. My lasting impression is that I am missing that blade on the top, for trimming. Really good razor but not quite the best.
I am satisfied with the product. The longevity of the section that holds the blade is suspect, but I will give an update at a later date. The blade cuts superbly!

I bought this razor to shave my arms. Yes I like to shave my arms. I’m impressed with the first shave using it. IMO it’s better than dsc, Harry’s, and Gillette! Way better than bic. I like my schick Quattro a bit better. Overall performance and price is well worth it.

First impressions - this razor set could very well replace all the others I've used over the years. Got a good, close shave (in the shower) to remove two days worth of stubble and was pleasantly surprised. I shave in the shower to soften the stubble and use the powerful shower stream to clean the blades several times to prevent clogging - I'm a bit OCD like that. I make sure the blades are clean when finished and tell myself I'm prolonging the life of the blades just a little. Let's face it - good blades are expensive, but these appear to be a good value for the $$ compared to the more expensive name brands.I've tried them all - cheap disposable plastic razors, the pricey Gillette Fusion blades, and everything in between to include electric shavers. The handle has good heft and is ergonomic, the blades attach and detach easily. With a large supply of extra blades included with this order I can shave regularly and not worry so much about the cost per blade. For me, that's a win-win. I'll update this review after a period of time if any changes in my initial impressions are off-base, but first impressions count for something. I like this razor kit.

These are not the sharpest blades but maybe that’s because I’m not shaving daily anymore, if I get around to it twice a week I’m doing good.  If I go an entire week, I have to trim my face first and I don’t have a heavy beard.

reviewTitle: Good razor, but I can't get under my nose
reviewDescription: If you prepare your face by taking a shower or using a hot towel to moisten your beard, these perform well. Very smooth and no nicks whatsoever. That said, the top of the razor gets in the way of the hairs just under your nose. I also find changing the blade to be a little wonky. I never get it the first try. Overall, they're a bargain compared to anything Gillette.
five shave max per blade

I love this razor! It's now my second time purchasing (I always wait a while before doing a review). However, I'm concerned that the blades that come in the original set that includes the razor is not as quality as the refills. When I bought the refill alone w/o the razor, the blades didn't come close in sharpness to the ones that came with the initial set. I'll continue to purchase anyways, just kind of a bummer since good razors are already so expensive.

reviewTitle: Not a close shave and no cigar!
reviewDescription: Despite all the best intentions this Amazon Basics version of a 5 blade shaving set falls short from fulfilling the promise.The shaving action of the 5 blades is at best disappointing as it leaves behind untreated areas that I  have to cover again (and again). Quite frankly, I get better results with my old and trusty two-blade Gillette.Moreover, with the large surface of the fiver I have little chance of cleaning up the area under my nose.  I tried to use the single blade side for that tight spot but after a considerably sized nick dropped that idea fast.Do I have anything positive to say about this 5-blades? Well, it's cheap and as always you get what you pay for, but I don't hate my face enough to put gentle shaving over saving a few buck.
Beware this item is not returnable. Further, it will not fit Gillete Fusion Razor
These blades are made in Mexico and do not fit Schlick five blade razors

reviewTitle: difficult if not Imposable to change blades.
reviewDescription: hard or imposable to change blades, cut myself on numerous occasions. Do not buy!

I've been using the Gillette Fusion since it was first issued, but I felt it time for a cheaper option. I will not be making that mistake anytime again soon. I also have used the Mach 3 for many years, and had switched to the EaseFit blades with very good results. Ironically, both blades are made by Personna, a brand I remember from more than half a century ago.As to the problems with Solimo:1) Never having used the swivel head type Gillette handle, I can not compare them, but I found Solimo's useless, i.e., no different from the stationary model.2) The lubricating strip was almost completely used in the first shave, depositing what looked and felt like strands of snot hanging off my face. Entirely GROSS!3} I have a pretty tough beard, but Gillette always dealt with efficiently. The Solimo blade required much more work, much harder work, to achieve less even results, and was harsh on my skin.4) The trimmer blade on the back of the top has a comb-like cover that, along with too close a set to the blade, making it useless.5) The blades was too dull to use after 4 shaves. Gillette's are always good for 20 shaves or more.6) When I attempted to change blades, none of them would attach to the handle.7) Amazon refused to accept the return.

reviewTitle: Terrible shave on curves...Grudgingly going back to Gillette Fusion
reviewDescription: Like many here I have used a Gillette Fusion for many years, and hate paying the price for their refills.  I took a chance on the Solimo MotionSphere Razor and was extremely disappointed.  This is a case of you get what you pay for, and the Gillette blades cut better on curved parts of your face and under your nose.The Good: On the fairly flat, open areas of your face (cheeks, neck) these perform well.The Bad: Shaving around your mouth, chin, and upper lip is kind of terrible, requiring many passes to get most of the offending stubble.  The shaving head is larger than a Fusion, making it difficult to get into position to shave the upper lip.  It's only a few millimeters bigger in all 3 dimensions, but it really hinders the ability to get everywhere.The Ugly:  The trimmer on the back used for trimming under the nose/sideburns is some sort of Hell-Rasp.  It completely fails to trim the hair, but somehow manages to scrape your skin raw.I'd love to try it again if they can evolve the design to deal with the above shortcomings while keeping at a similar price point.  Until then I'm saving my pennies and going back to the Fusion.

reviewTitle: If you are looking for a comfortable shave dont buy this one.
reviewDescription: These blades feel dull, and are not good for more than three shaves.
The razor was very cheap, and the blades didn’t last, terrible buy !
This the worst razor. Got dall almost as fast as I started shaving. A 3 or 4 blade cheap Gillette is better option.

Perhaps this razor would work for someone with very fine hair  but for someone with average to thick facial hair these blades are not the blades you are looking for.Good shavers often have a first blade that lifts and pulls in order to present the hairs to the following blades,  this is pretty much standard in the industry.  But Amazon's  Solimo 5 blade disposable  gets this all wrong.  the first blade bites too hard ,  pulls the following blades into the skin too strongly  leaving the user prone to be cut.I have found i have move very slowly very carefully  using Amazon's blade  otherwise my skin gets little nicks as the hairs are pulled too hard ......in short it takes more time and effort to complete the job and the job is poorly completed...  not exactly a premium feel or finish.furthermore the shaver is clumsily large for the size of the blades,  the lubstrip is huge and gets in the way around the nose leaving me with little hairs around my nostrils ....simply put the bumpers are too big and there is not enough flex  to the shaver...  i end up having to grab a  better razor to finish around my nose or walk around all day looking like someone who does not know how to shave....
Unable to connect handle to new blade. Waste of money. First time bad product from Amazon. To late to return.

reviewTitle: head doesn't move well, leaves disgusting slime on face
reviewDescription: the head doesn't move well when shaving, but moves easily with my hand.moisturizer bar leaves slime on my face. every time i pull the razor from my face i had a 1-3 inch long string of clear slime going from the razor to my face. looked like spiderman had fun on my face.shaves more closely by about 2 mm than my store brand 3-blade razors but i'm going to try gillette and see how that goes.thought all these rave reviews meant it was almost as good as gillette but cheaper because this company what trying to give you the same product without gouging your wallet with a brand name. this is a case of "you get what you pay for" pay a little more money for gillette or something else that works for you. gillette worked great for me years ago. gonna try them again.the nose hair trimmer on this razor is a joke. more like sharpened BBQ scraper. was uncomfortable and not very fast.razor does a good job on the smoothness. i use a 3-blade store brand razor or a safety razor with feather blades. this razor is smoother shave than either. that's really all it has going for it. and the fact that it shaves 2mm closer than my 3-blade.the webs of slime on my face and lack of proper razor head movement is total turn off. finished other 2 thirds of my face with my 3 blade.

Right out of the box I found handle and blade seemingly quite comfortable then I tried to shave.  Not at all satisfied.  I do shave my head and face.  The blade seemed unable to give me a smooth shave.  Even stroke after stroke my head would never get smooth.  I tried more shave crème with out any improvements.  I finished my poor shave and went about my business.  Two days later the same scenario with a new blade and same results.  Very disappointed.  I want to return the product but I have thrown out the box.  I’m going to research options for another blade but rest assured I will not suggest to anyone to use this system.

reviewTitle: Shaving over 30 years, worst 3 or 5 blade ever (bad batch or something)
reviewDescription: I like Amazon Brand of things but these razors stink, flat out don't work.And their dish soap is a joke. Other than that so far Amazon is the best

It's not so great, when new it hurts a bit, I used another brand before and when new you don't feel a thing but with this ones you do, I miss the old one, got this because of price and the five blades but it's not better it's worst, next time I'll pay more

These razors just hurt. Lubrication strip does not compensate for a brand new blade being dull. Yes, I water my face. Yes, I used shaving cream. Yes, it still hurt. I don’t think I can get a second use out of these blades and now I have 16 of the damn things.

I’ve been shaving for 10 years. I’ve never encountered a razor that was as poor of a design as the Amazon brand razor. One shouldn’t have to shave over one day’s worth of stubble a half a dozen times to achieve a clean look. I strongly suggest purchasing another brand.
Absolutely terrible razor. Extremely dull. Do not buy!
Very cheap. Doesnt shave good.blade doesnt last long

reviewTitle: Most full razors I've ever used
reviewDescription: Don't try and save money by buying these.  They literally rip the hair out of your body.
Switched from one of the other online razor companys.  I think these give you a better shave without the razor burn.
I loved the close shave but the blades are so hard to replace on the handles! Women’s razor blades just slip right on but these ones I had a tough time with!
I like it, but they don't seem to last as long as other razors i have used.

Let's face it. The benchmark for all cartridges is always the two top brands costing $4-5 per cart. There is a reason for that; they perform better than the rest. I've used just about every alternative to the top brands. Saving a little money is rarely worth it, but the Solimo will save you much more, which makes these a compelling alternative. The handle is very good; as good as any other. That is unless you still prefer a power feature that is unavailable on the Solimo. I like how it feels and the movement of the head.The bottom line is always how does it shave? The cart shaves just as close as any I have ever used. The slight trade-off is that it is not quite as smooth. More directly, the shave is more on the aggressive side. Not so much so that it is uncomfortable, but I had to get used to it. I'm ok with it now.Closeness, not a problem. Shaves very close, as well as the big brands.I still haven't figured out how many shaves is optimal, but I can get at 5-7 shaves so far. I haven't pushed it further because there is no need to at this price point.Putting it all together - These are competitive, perhaps not quite as comfortable, but completely acceptable, combined with the low price point make these blades a solid contender. Of course, everyone is different. These blades are surely worth a try.I have used both 3 blade and 5 blade. I like the efficiency of the 5 blade a bit better, but they both work similarly. Pick your favorite and go.In the end, I think these blades overall are a solid #3 compared to the top two brands. Better than all of the other less expensive alternatives out there.  At 1/4 of the price, it's pretty easy to use these blades as your number 1.

I've been using a Gillette Fusion I got as a review item right up until I went through the blades for it and I had to go looking for replacements. I just couldn't justify the price, they're TOO expensive. I got this Solimo handle and 14 blade replacements cartridges for less than the price of an 8-pack of Gillette cartridges.The angle of the Solimo razor is a bit extreme. Much flatter than any other razor I've used in my 40+ years of shaving. I can do my head fairly well though I have to go at a couple spots more than once but I experience that with every razor. The one spot I really have trouble with is my left cheek and neck. I've got some arthritis issues in my elbows and getting my arm to bend the right way to shave there is painful and takes some effort.I can usually get 6 or 7 head and face shaves before the blades start to dull. This says these have lubricating strips but they don't seem to dissolve or wear away like others do. Once the blades feel dull I can go 1 or 2 more shaves before I have to switch the head out.For the price this a rather decent razor.
It works and feels nice but it's not close. Your 5 oclock shadow will show up at 3. Except for that it works well

reviewTitle: The best mediocre shave for the money
reviewDescription: The price is nice but the shave is just OK. I didn't get a close shave, still stubble after the shave.

reviewTitle: I am switching to this razor
reviewDescription: The razor wobbles a bit when you shake it after each rinse.  The wobble looks flimsy in my opinion.  BUT- it shaves way better than old my old razor.  I get a smoother shave that lasts longer through the day.  I have already broke up with my other shave club and I will be ordering these Amazon blades soon.

reviewTitle: Cheap - Doesn't last as long as I'd hope
reviewDescription: Blades don't stay sharp as long as I'd hope.. With thick hair, the razors will get little burs that cause discomfort while shaving. At the price this costs I can't complain though. Just throw a fresh one in!

reviewTitle: Great for the price, precision trimmer is awful
reviewDescription: Firstly, these are a fantastic value product, providing a "very average" shave at a great price. What I mean by very average is that it's not one of the closest shaves I've had but it gets the job done.If you're used to higher-end razors, you will certainly notice the difference, but what did you expect at around $1/cartridge?My biggest gripe about these, however, is that the precision trimmer on the back of the blade is terrible. I have a full beard and use the precision trimmer extensively to clean up my cheeks and edges but on these cartridges, the blade felt as if it was extremely dull. It left my skin around the edges and my cheeks very irritated and overall did not do a good job getting close.PROS- Insanely good price for the blades- Included handle has some weight to it and feels like other top brands- Hair cleans easily from between the blades and does not clog- Provides an acceptable shave (not the closest but still a close shave)CONS- Precision trimmer is practically useless- Vitamin E strip is very "gooey" at the beginning- Cartridges only work with their handle (although, as mentioned above, the handle is not bad)- Cartridges are kind of large compared to the space the blades take up which makes it harder to be accurateBottom line is, these are great for the price and I would recommend them to most guys. If you're clean shaven or use them for body hair, you'll likely be satisfied. If you're someone who needs the blade on the back, I would suggest something else.
The blades were so dull it was ridiculous! I only got one use out of the cartridges! I will never buy it again!

reviewTitle: You Get What You Pay For
reviewDescription: Disclaimer: I don't shave every day, so the stubble I accumulate might be more than the average person. Having said that, these razors are a poor alternative to the Gillette Mach3 or Fusion5 razors that I have used. These razors aren't nearly as sharp as those. I'm assuming that the 5-star reviews for this product are folks who have never used a high-quality razor.

reviewTitle: Run unless you need to save money
reviewDescription: These say compare to Gillette. I did. I'm running back to Gillette. The difference is night and day with Gillette being far superior in quality. Do better Amazon Basics. Do much better.
I bought these based on my past experience with Amazon products. Thinking they would be as high of standards. Terrible, dull.

These razors are trash. I originally got the 3 blade with the handle. I had to go over the same spot 3 or 4 times to cut the hair. I thought that maybe the 5 blade would be better. Nope. Just as bad. Waste of money. I should have gone with Harry's or dollar shave club.

I ordered the blades based on the reviews and was trying to save some money on blades but after getting the product I was very displeased with the blades and handle.Outward appearance they looked OK but after I started shaving with the blades I found out very quickly that  it was a very poor razor system. It felt like I was ripping out the whiskers instead of cutting them and after shaving it felt like I still needed to shave again to get a close shave.When I attempted to change the blade I found out how poorly the handle and blade were designed, it took several attempts to get the new blade on the handle. Poor workmanship with plastics.I woulsd not recommend them .
It appears  the cartridges are covered with growth hormone or something. I have so much hair after I shave.
Will not cut beard at all, a waist of money, could not return because I threw away the box the razor and blades came in. Please never buy this product!

I've been shaving with this new razor and it's been painful.  The razor is pulling at the hair on my face rather than cleanly cutting or shaving the hair.  Finally I tried another blade and it did the same thing.  So I grabbed my old Schick razor which is nothing special, not much different, and it still cuts like butter.  I refuse to believe that this product is that horrible, so maybe they produced a bad ratch of razor cartridges.  It's over the 30 day return policy, therefore I am extremely disappointed.
This razor does not give a close shave and is very irritating to the skin. Very disappointing.
we gave them a try because they were not expensive, but sometimes you get what you pay for

reviewTitle: no es útil para personas velludas
reviewDescription: En general el producto se ve bien ...pero en mi caso se me irrita la piel con facilidad y tengo la barba bien tupida, este producto no me ayudo en nada ....no pude afeitarme ni una sola vez, tiene muchas hojas pero no sirvieron de mucho, al final tuve que terminar con otra maquina de afeitar.

reviewTitle: Dull from the start, gets worse fast.
reviewDescription: I used Mach 3s forever, like 20+ years. I got these hoping they'd be a cheaper alternative. Straight from the package, these feels like a week-old Gillete blade. They get uncomfortably dull after maybe 4 shaves. They also leave an annoying slime like thing on your chin from whatever coating is on them. Add to all this that there's so much space from the top blade to the top of the razor, it's hard to get the space close under your nose.The handle is nice and feels sturdy, the attachment point to the blades is annoying and finicky.Two stars because even though I ordered 17 blades, they won't last all that long and I can throw this thing away sooner.

The razor itself is fine.The single "trim" blade is a HAZARD. Apparently, no thought was given to the blade's angle of attack. If you flip that thing over and touch it to your face, it will draw blood guaranteed.If you don't need the trim blade, it's a decent economical razor.

reviewTitle: You get what you pay for!
reviewDescription: I’ve been shaving for over 50 years. The Gillette Fusion 5 seemed to getting pricey, around $3.50 a blade. So I tried this less expensive brand. I stretch the Gillette to about 20-25 shaves. My old Gillette 15 shaves in is smoother than this brand new blade.,Back to Gillette Fusion 5- NO COMPARISON
Each cartridge is only good for about two solid shaves, they dull very quickly. Not good quality blades. Other brands last at least six shaves minimum. Do the math, not a good purchase.

I was excited to try these new razors and handle. The razor cartridges seemed pretty good with a thick lubricating strip and a trim blade. The handle is heavyweight and pivots side to side and up and down which I really liked. Unfortunately these are the only positive qualities these cartridges and handle have. Been using these cartridges for about two weeks. I change out my blades every single week. The blades drag across your face and don’t appear to be very sharp. I’ve tried different, shaving creams and lotions, but nothing seem to help. Very possibly one of the worst shaving experiences I’ve had. In order to get any kind of a decent shave, you have to apply a lot of pressure with the cartridge on your face, but that just increases the razor burn. These cartridges may work for someone new to shaving and does not have course hair or thick beard growth but for someone who has been shaving for a while, these will be very uncomfortable to use. I will not be ordering these razor cartridges again, and I cannot recommend them to anyone.
Handle to wide and hard too grip.get cut often in tight spots. From now on i will pay a couple bucks more for mach3 which I have been using for 25 years.

reviewTitle: Does not give a close shave
reviewDescription: This shaver did not give me a close shave even when I shaved up.

This razr blade while looks well made is not working for me. The blades don't seem sharp enough and yanks my beard while shaving. Used lots of shaving cream but didnt help. Didn't work for me so I threw them away, cant speak for everyone though that was just my experience
I bought these razor blades for my husband who has sensitive skin and he is very happy with them.

reviewTitle: Great quality and the price is amazing.
reviewDescription: Way better than the Henry's I was using before.
good product
I have been using these razors for two years and they are the best! They last a long time!I will buy again. Fast shipping!

I like these better than Dollar and Harry's. They are a bit sturdier and the blade doesn't fall off when I tap it on sink to clean it. I have a light beard so I'm not sure it's good for a heavier beard.
This is probably the best razor I've ever owned. Love it!
Works just like the expensive name brands

reviewTitle: Can’t beat the value for the price
reviewDescription: Does its job and works just as well as the more expensive counterparts. Replacement razors areCheap and available
Very smooth shave long lasting blades

I love the price. That's what got me here. Since I received this razor I've used it twice. To trim my mustache it has a nice single edged blade on one side thats lined with lubricant strip. It works amazingly. The blades that arrived are really sharp and also have a lubricant strip. I used this razor to shave my head. The outcome is a smooth, sleek comfortable shave and I love it. The handle for the blades is well made with a little weight to it. Which I absolutely love and look for in a reusable handle. It doesn't feel cheap whatsoever. This is well thought out shaving equipment that I will definitely be purchasing the blades again. I recommend. I've been using my current reusable blades for over 20 years but, they stopped making them and the ones available, if I still find them are priced astronomical. I did my homework for replacement and now I find it. Excellent job Amazon.

Let me start by saying - I hate Gillette razors. Hate their pricing, hate their longevity (2-3 full leg shaves if I go more than 2 days between, though last a while if I use them for face or underarm), hate the monopoly they seem to have over the razor industry. And I love what Amazon is doing, trying to disrupt that and offer an alternative at a much lower price per razor. However, for me, these just are not there yet. Their longevity is noticeably worse, and I ended up using them essentially as fancy disposables. They dulled very quickly, which really hurts on my inner/back of thigh areas, so I had to swap almost every other shave. Really wanted to like them, but unfortunately I'll be going back to Gillette until I can try out Leaf. A last little annoyance, which I could have absolutely stomached for the price, if they lasted enough - the razor heads are much more difficult to get on the handle than other brands, and very difficult to take out on their own without the handle. Needed some tweezers to assist.

reviewTitle: Not quite as smooth as Fusion, but less than half the price
reviewDescription: Tested on a 3 day growth, my last new fusion against this Amazon Basics razor. I have medium stubble, so if you have a thick stiff beard my results will be different for you. Switched between the two in all areas. Fusion was a smoother shave. Basics was good but could feel very slight pulling. Shaved area was just as smooth. No cuts or nicks just a perception that Fusion "felt" better. I can't remark on longevity of the Basics compared to the Fusion which lasts well for me.I am going to keep the Basics and see how they hold up. Setting my Fusion aside for awhile until I get used to the Basics so I can redo the test. Fusion is the best blades I have used, so comparing them to the Basics isn't exactly fair considering the huge price discrepancy.. Basics are good, maybe VG, blades. Fusion blades are just grossly overpriced. The width above the top blade on the Basics is annoying under the nose as others have said. Very Poor design. You can shave under your nose, just takes bit of patience and goofy facial expressions. The back trimmer blade is more of a gimmick and not worth the extra width it makes at top of the blades.If it was just a dollar or so difference in price of 5 blades, the Basics would be returned without a second thought.  But with runaway inflation, less expensive alternatives need investigation.

My experience...skin/hair/hand type: sensitive | fine/ginger/blonde | large/big - very long fingersI've been shaving for quite a while, tried disposables and electric in youth, converted to Gillette Sensor cartridges (which I was very happy with), then came the Mach and eventually Fusion. I started having quality/consistency issues with Fusions, tried Schick and did not like, continued with Gillette...The quality/consistency issues continued with Gillette, in addition they started raising prices to levels that I thought I really should not have to deal with quality/consistency issues with...Reluctantly I had to shop for alternatives. There were a lot of new names in the market. I settled on DORCO Pace 6, great price, great shave and that was my new razor, then they came out with the DORCO Pace 7 blade, best razor and shave I'd ever had and that was my new razor!Eventually Gillette sues DORCO, Dorco leaves the market, though you can still find the cartridges on amazon they are much more expensive than they previously were and sold by what appears to be trial lawyers from that case...I was back to the cost of shave again, forced to shop for another option and stumbled across Amazon's Solimo, great shave, great price! I've tested several refills before writing this review and have been very pleased with the shave, longevity of blade, as well as price.pluses:I like the plastic blade guard - I'd often wished other razor brands offered one.Handle is comfortable and weighted. Throughout all of these models/brands I've always kept my favored Gillette Sensor on hand, simply because I often felt many of these bigger multi-bladed razors were just too big to trim the corners of my mouth, but I find with the Solimo I don't have to fall back to it very often, which is good because I doubt I could find replacement cartridges for it any more!TIP: dry your blades when you're finished shaving. I get an extra shave or two out of the blades by doing this.Will update review if any there are any changes in the future
Very good razor for the price and it has a nice weigh to it.

reviewTitle: Pay attention to the one you’re getting rid of.

reviewTitle: The Price Makes Up For Some Shortcomings
reviewDescription: I switched from an electric to a cartridge razor about two months ago.  During that period, on the cartridge razor side, I've used the Gillette Pro Fusion 5 and the Solimo.  Here are my thoughts.Trim Blade:  Gillette wins out here significantly.  They both do the job, but the Gillette does it while giving me a feeling of safety.  When I use the Solimo, I can tell that if I'm not careful it could quite easily gouge me in a major way.  Actually, it did put a 1 inch long very thin surface cut on me once.  I've since learned how to respect it and I think I can use it safely now.  But I still consider it a disadvantage of the Solimo.  This is my most significant problem with the Solimo.Blade Longevity:  No clear winner here.  Most of the time, a Solimo cartridge gives me about the same number of shaves as a Gillette cartridge on the Gillette handle.  But one of the four Solimo cartridges I've used so far seemed to be an anomaly.  It lasted only about 4 shaves.  So quality control could be beefed up here.Maneuverability;  Gillette wins out here.  The Solimo head is wider from front to back.  Its two lubrication strips, or whatever they are are both wider than the Gillette's.  With the larger cutting head, it's not quite as easy to get into the detail spots.Comfort:  No clear winner here.  They're about the same for me.Cartridge Installation:  Gillette is the clear winner here.  Their cartridges snap right into the handle with no effort on my part.  Getting the Solimo cartridge onto the Solimo handle seems to be an obstacle course.  It often takes me several tries.  But I don't consider this to be a big problem.  It takes me an extra 15 seconds once a week.Head staying on handle:  No winner here. Some have complained that the Solimo head accidentally pops off the handle during use, or when cleaning it.  I've not seen that problem at all with either razor.Price of Cartridges: Solimo wins so big here that I feel that it more than makes up for the other areas mentioned above where it falls behind the Gillette.Summary:  While the Gillette outperforms the Solimo in a number of areas,  none of the Gillette advantages are nearly as significant as the drastically lower cost of the Solimo cartridges.  If money were no object, I'd use the Gillette.  But since my income is not infinite, the price is a very important part of the equation.Final Judgement:  I continue to use the Solimo and have let my Gillette cartridges run out.

reviewTitle: Almost as good as the really expensive ones
reviewDescription: After reading a few reviews, I hesitated to buy these.  I got a "free razor" in the mail that included a few blades.  When I went through those I went and bought some more.  Holy cow, they are expensive!  So when I had used those up, I started to look for another options.  Those drug store twin and triple blade disposable razors should be disposed of before you use them, junk.  Found a good pack someplace about 8 years ago, but don't remember where I got them, so can not get new blades.  So finally broke down and ordered these.I am happy.  Since 2020 I don't need to shave much anymore.  I am only in an office a couple days a week, and even if I have a day or two of growth, it is OK.  And by not shaving every day, it seems to be growing slower.  So I shave 2 or maybe 3 times a week.  This razor cuts off that couple day growth, no problem.  It has a moisturizer strip which for some reason seems "stringy."  When I am done with most of it and just cleaning up a few missed spots, it leaves a stringy residue.  I was thinking that strip would be gone after a couple shaves, but still there after probably 10 shaves now.  I wash my face after shaving, so that strip does not matter to me.The blades stay sharp.  I am still on the first set of blades, been a couple months now.  I usually replace them when I get my first cut, or it is pulling.  Neither is happening.Are they as good as the really expensive brands (the ones that where drug stores lock up the blades), maybe not quite as good, but certainly better than a lot of inexpensive options out there.  I am very happy with this razor set.

reviewTitle: Good value razors - get the job done on a budget
reviewDescription: These razors are a budget minded alternative to the big brand name much more expensive options.

I have used nearly every brand of safety razor that has any adoption. I have used Schick, Gillette - the Mach 3, the ProGlide, the Fusion ProGlide, the Sensor3, the Quattro, the Hydro. I've used online services like Harry's and Dollar Shave Club. I've used multiple straight razors and bled - bled like a stuck pick, because while I have sensitive skin, I am also really bad at shaving with a standard razor, because I suck at being manly and tough. That's a joke, I just don't know how to use striaght razors, I considered "only cutting myself six times" to be a success. And yes. I did use them for six months. And man, did people think I joined a fight club. A fight club with knives.I have sensitive skin. Razor burn isn't a possibility, it's a guarantee. It's going to happen, it's just a question of "how bad?" I have seborrheic dermatitis, a semi-mild form, so I have to use very specific soaps on my face, and just generally have to take special care of my face. The razor burn makes me not want to shave, but taking more time between shaves also means the razor burn gets worse. It's a terribly not-too-serious case of "ugh, ow and gross."I have a 14 month-old cat. He's still very kitten-y. He has manic energy, and a tendency to find new ways to make trouble. So, after my recent refill of my Harry's order of 16 cartridges, he knocked my Harry's handle on the bathroom floor, un-sealing the adhesive between the handle and the cartridge mechanism. Well, great. I can spend $15 on the handle, or i can.. not do that. I decided, "well, crap, Amazon's home brand has a new system for about the same price for a new handle AND 16 cartridges."I've waited several days, to maximize the crappy discomfort of razor burn, and am.. surprised. There is burn, to be clear. There is redness. But nowhere near as severe as I'd expect. And it didn't eat through an entire cartridge - or two. Harry's cartridges are inexpensive, but flimsy in that they are easily overwhelmed if you don't shave daily. Or every other day. I work from home semi-permanently (thanks, Covid), so I don't need to shave every day. Harry's razors do not handle that well at all.I have to believe Amazon must be selling these at a loss. The cartridges are, somehow, good quality. They aren't easily overwhelmed by long stretches of not shaving (I expect you CAN, if you go weeks), they're firm but flexible, the gel strip is not decorative - it has a purpose, and it does what you expect (.. Harry's, take note). You can easily go with the grain or against the grain (with so many breaks between shaves, I like a very smooth shave) and not feel like you're risking your face (DSC, Harry's). It's surprising.I'll stick around. This was meant to just give Amazon a fair shot, but it turns out a fair shot makes me wonder why I paid nearly triple ($33 for 12) in the past for Fusion5 cartridges.

reviewTitle: Easily Replaces other inferior 5-Blade Razors. Excellent Razor.
reviewDescription: I was ready to try something different by the time I ran across this Amazon Solimo Razor.I had purchased Dorco’s 6-Blade razor with enough cartridges in 2015 to last until late 2019. (They were on a huge sale at the time.)Since then, I think Dorco has moved to selling on Amazon and I didn’t like the prices this time around.After 4 years of using the same razor and brand, I wanted to see what else was out there.I’ve done the major brands and frankly haven’t been happy with the results.I usually let my facial hair grow out for a few weeks until I look scruffy and then shave.I really hate to shave. I hate it even more when the blades cut me or pull the hairs.Now that you have some background, let me give you what you came to read.The Solimo is an excellent 5-blade razor for the money. I didn’t get a single cut, and I shaved when the hairs were over a 1/4 inch long. The blades didn’t clog. The open back design minimized the plastic ribbing that holds the blades in place and hold the cartridge to the handle, leaving plenty of open space to flush the hairs out with running water. Speaking of water, my sinks use a farmhouse style faucet where the water runs down a long trough and rolls off the end. Not exactly good water pressure for rinsing out a razor, and yet surprisingly, because of the great design of this cartridge, it rinsed the Solimo cartridge out completely. This was a critical pass/fail feature for me. I had fought clogging for the past 4 years with my last razor.With my old 6-blade razor I was constantly fighting with hairs staying trapped in the cartridge between the blades and the plastic cartridge ribs. Because it stayed clogged, it took many more strokes to get all of my face and neck shaved. The cartridges usually ended up in the garbage after only one or two shaves because I couldn’t get the hairs cleaned out of them.The Solimo still required multiple strokes because the hairs were so long this time when I shaved, but I could easily see it cutting more efficiently on a face with shorter hairs.I can’t speak much about the razor’s ability to conform to the curves of the face because of the cartridges ability to move left and right as well as up and down. However, as I said, I walked away cut-free despite making multiple strokes over the same areas.I was skeptical at buying the head with 16 cartridges, but when I considered that if it worked out, I would spend more actually buying those cartridges separately, buying the set made more sense. I mean, it wasn’t a huge risk I was taking here. The blades just need to cut the hair off your face. I don’t think it’s that easy to screw up a razor design.The head seems designed well. The cartridges snap into the head securely and I found the rubberized handle to be very grippy and offer good control of the wet handle. The quality of the handle is nice and the attention to details make it feel like a more expensive razor than it is.These cartridges are by far the cheapest cost I’ve seen. I think it comes out to a little over a $1 each to buy them if my memory is correct.I would never go back to expensive razors again, but I don’t want cheap junk either.Solimo makes a great razor in my opinion and I’ll recommend them to anyone.I also enjoy their coffee as well.

I don't know if it is the design of the handle/blade, or the way I hold the thing, but I find myself being cut much more frequently with these blades than I do with the Gilettes. These things are sharp, probably sharper than the Fusion blades. Wicked sharp. And they nick so easily. I am on Eliquis, so not a good combination. In the week I've been using the first set of blades, I've cut myself three times. All three required a bandage. Never had this problem with the Gilettes. Interesting because I switched from the pricy Fusions to these because big pharma raised the price of my Eliquis to $450. So, I have to economize somewhere else. A few bucks here and there, and I can buy one more Eliquis. But then I bleed easily, and I have to buy bandages. There's no winning.Any way, back to the blades. I have 15 of them, and I figure at this rate, I'll need a blood transfusion, too. They do a good job slicing through the thick meadow of old whiskers. It may be the handle that's not up to par, or it could be my aim. Good value for the money, I'm sure. Just ought to include bandages.
